commit_message:
Merge default_listen with swift_proxy_server_listen_options

Currently haproxy for swift doesn't have default setting. This generates config
such as

  listen swift_proxy_server
  bind 10.0.0.5:13808 transparent ssl crt /etc/pki/tls/private/overcloud_endpoint.pem
  bind 172.16.1.4:8080 transparent
  option httpchk GET /healthcheck
  timeout client 2m
  timeout server 2m
  server overcloud-controller-0.storage.localdomain 172.16.1.10:8080 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

without

  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https if { ssl_fc }
  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http if !{ ssl_fc }
  option httplog

This makes really hard to debug in case of issues.

This patch merges default_listen_options with swift to have config which is
more reliable for debugging

Closes-Bug: #1764731
Change-Id: I6716499b4a10f3ba39db33d6468c261c58ee373d

subject: Do not require the bootstrap password to come in via arguments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 00:05:01.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/keystone/keystone_bootstrap.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/556ea33076eba45864c691f7302067dc08892bfd', 'message': 'Do not require the bootstrap password to come in via arguments

Currently when this is being ran, and say ara is being used to
capture the running of kolla-ansible ara will capture the full
command line ran (even if no_log is set); because by default these
modules do not hide what they are running.

So to avoid the situation where the command line shows the password
have this also be able to take in the password via an environment
variable as well (which ara will not capture).

Change-Id: I4d42d592d8031d0f3923bccc6b2db1149af08e75
'}]
commit_message:
Do not require the bootstrap password to come in via arguments

Currently when this is being ran, and say ara is being used to
capture the running of kolla-ansible ara will capture the full
command line ran (even if no_log is set); because by default these
modules do not hide what they are running.

So to avoid the situation where the command line shows the password
have this also be able to take in the password via an environment
variable as well (which ara will not capture).

Change-Id: I4d42d592d8031d0f3923bccc6b2db1149af08e75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/84/556684/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -z "$PASSWORD" ]; then # Avoid having the password always come in via CLI (which makes # it show up in things like ara) PASSWORD="$OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD" fi

commit_message:
test.stub_object

In a spirit similar to stub_out, stub_object does mock patching, but on
an object.

This is in response to many of the patches in this group:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/mox-removal

...which replaced object-like mox's with stub_out, which usually works,
but isn't the same thing.

Change-Id: Ifdd04a1c317700dc7401acccfa0724a9108b15c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/560683/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def stub_object(self, obj, symbol, **kwargs): """Replace an object attribute for the duration of the test. :return: The mock, so it can be mucked with. """ return self.useFixture( fixtures.MockPatchObject(obj, symbol, **kwargs)).mock

commit_message:
Use the loop device in fstab instead of image file

When adding an fstab entry for a loopback device use the explicit
loopback device name rather than the source image file. This prevents
a new loopback device being created implitcitly when mounting the
image.

The unit tests needed updating to reflect that the loopback
device name is used when creating mountpoint names rather than than
the name of the image file. This was pre-existing behaviour.

Change-Id: Ide074310bf7121f1179e0b5237dff6f3da88e24e
Closes-Bug: #1762390
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-swift-storage refs/changes/09/560009/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import charmhelpers.core.fstab if loopback_device: # If an exiting fstab entry exists using the image file as the # source then preserve it, otherwise use the loopback device # directly to avoid a secound implicit loopback device being # created on mount. Bug #1762390 fstab = charmhelpers.core.fstab.Fstab() fstab_entry = fstab.get_entry_by_attr('mountpoint', mountpoint) if fstab_entry: dev = fstab_entry.device options = "loop,defaults"
deleted_lines: if loopback_device: dev = loopback_device options = "loop, defaults"

commit_message:
Work around version check bug in poise-python

There is a broken version check that triggers on pip version 10, see
[1]. Pin pip to version 9.0.3 as a workaround for now.

[1] https://github.com/poise/poise-python/issues/107

commit_message:
Add formatting param for disk usage

Pass formatting option to ceph for easier postprocessing.
Constrain to values accepted by ceph, default to plain format.

Change-Id: I0bb8cfcd8d8962988e786d2d083b1489161b2ff6
Closes-Bug: #1724880

subject: Fix OVSDB Error seen during startup if OVN worker doesn't have lock
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 07:22:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/33deadf2b72a99987d62372c426670fdcdd8f9f4', 'message': "Fix OVSDB Error seen during startup if OVN worker doesn't have lock

An OVN Worker handles the create/update notifications only if it has acquired
the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock'. by checking 'idl.is_lock_contended' to
true. 'idl.is_lock_contended' is expected to be true if the ovn worker has
requested for the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock' from the ovsdb-server and
acquired it. Looks like there is a bug in python ovs idl code because of
which 'idl.is_lock_contended' is set to true even if it doesn't have the lock.

This issue should be fixed in python ovs idl. But it is better to be explicit
in networking-ovn. So this patch fixes the issue by inversing the logic in the
OvnIdl.notify() function by handling the event only if 'idl.lock_name and
idl.has_lock' is true.

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I35c6514f79065c2227c1ffeeb08532c4858055d2

commit_message:
Fix OVSDB Error seen during startup if OVN worker doesn't have lock

An OVN Worker handles the create/update notifications only if it has acquired
the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock' by checking 'idl.is_lock_contended' to
true. 'idl.is_lock_contended' is expected to be true if the ovn worker has
requested for the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock' from the ovsdb-server and
acquired it. Looks like there is a bug in python ovs idl code because of
which 'idl.is_lock_contended' is set to true even if it doesn't have the lock.

This issue should be fixed in python ovs idl. But it is better to be explicit
in networking-ovn. So this patch fixes the issue by inversing the logic in the
OvnIdl.notify() function by handling the event only if 'idl.lock_name and
idl.has_lock' is true.

This patch also fixes the 'has_lock' check in maintenance thread.

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I35c6514f79065c2227c1ffeeb08532c4858055d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/95/560295/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Suppress conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option

This patch fixes conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option.
To suppress this conflicts, when retry option selected this patch clears
auto_remove option and set readonly attribute for the checkbox.

Also, to check them easily from user, move auto_remove option from
Miscellaneous tab to Spec tab, i.e. under retry options.

Change-Id: I34a409141adf1ad822e5999240ccbb8ae8e2acf5
Closes-Bug: #1763250
(cherry picked from commit 1d47c368fe4ef5f8ef360296dd1ed4fc149f0b7e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun-ui refs/changes/18/562118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: config.model.auto_remove = response.data.auto_remove ? response.data.auto_remove : false; if (config.model.auto_remove) { config.model.exit_policy = "remove"; } else { config.model.exit_policy = config.model.restart_policy; }

commit_message:
Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586

commit_message:
Reduce scope of the lock for image volume cache

Refactor the code that creates a volume from a downloaded glance image
to minimize the scope of the lock that prevents multiple entries in the
volume image cache. Now the lock serializes only the portion of the
code that causes the cache entry to be created. Locking is minimized
when the volume is already cached, or when the volume won't be cached.

Closes-Bug: #1758414
Change-Id: I547fb4bcdd4783225b8ca96d157c61ca3bcf4ef4
(cherry picked from commit a351cd01c0bf937e82efc3e1256da479be24cfcf)
(cherry picked from commit bc05efc79aaedd06308f7f173df09fd6a23aa2b3)

added_lines: def _prepare_image_cache_entry(self, context, volume, image_location, image_id, image_meta, image_service): internal_context = cinder_context.get_internal_tenant_context() if not internal_context: return None, False cache_entry = self.image_volume_cache.get_entry(internal_context, volume, image_id, image_meta) # If the entry is in the cache then return ASAP in order to minimize # the scope of the lock. commit_message:
Prevent duplicate entries in the image cache

Add a synchronization lock to prevent duplicate entries in the image
cache. The relevant code was refactored into its own function in order
to reduce the scope of the lock.

Closes-Bug: #1649636
Change-Id: I979f966c821876750b2a616ef32a905192eafbd6
(cherry picked from commit 63aa3c7d1cf73e18067a7ae3a68a173359994aab)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.20

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I83235b2051ab4ebd24f79ff5f91575dc6f16b7c0
Change-Id: Id2ab1c4b53def85f156daa5d1b7ef986e26924b8

commit_message:
Fix up amulet for queens

* Fix up amulet tests to use keystone v3 clients.
* Add xenial/queens to gate

Change-Id: I6e870571cec65fe4cd55384c6c84761b71e92d77
(cherry picked from commit 028887ed6de3a5a5c79a0e072cac2b4521e5df96)

'publicURL': publicURL, 'internalURL': internalURL }], } """ self.log.warn("Endpoint ID and Region ID validation is limited to not " "null checks after v2 to v3 conversion") for svc in ep_data.keys(): assert len(ep_data[svc]) == 1, "Unknown data format" svc_ep_data = ep_data[svc][0] ep_data[svc] = [ { 'url': svc_ep_data['adminURL'], 'interface': 'admin', 'region': svc_ep_data['region'], 'region_id': self.not_null, 'id': self.not_null}, { 'url': svc_ep_data['publicURL'], 'interface': 'public', 'region': svc_ep_data['region'], 'region_id': self.not_null, 'id': self.not_null}, { 'url': svc_ep_data['internalURL'], 'interface': 'internal', 'region': svc_ep_data['region'], 'region_id': self.not_null, 'id': self.not_null}] return ep_data def validate_svc_catalog_endpoint_data(self, expected, actual, openstack_release=None): """Validate service catalog endpoint data. Pick the correct validator for the OpenStack version. Expected data should be in the v2 format: { 'service_name1': [ { 'adminURL': adminURL, 'id': id, 'region': region. 'publicURL': publicURL, 'internalURL': internalURL }], 'service_name2': [ { 'adminURL': adminURL, 'id': id, 'region': region. 'publicURL': publicURL, 'internalURL': internalURL }], } """ validation_function = self.validate_v2_svc_catalog_endpoint_data xenial_queens = OPENSTACK_RELEASES_PAIRS.index('xenial_queens') if openstack_release and openstack_release >= xenial_queens: validation_function = self.validate_v3_svc_catalog_endpoint_data expected = self.convert_svc_catalog_endpoint_data_to_v3(expected) return validation_function(expected, actual) def validate_v2_svc_catalog_endpoint_data(self, expected, actual): if not api_version: api_version = 2 sess, auth = self.get_keystone_session( keystone_ip=keystone_ip, username=username, password=password, api_version=api_version, admin_port=admin_port, user_domain_name=user_domain_name, domain_name=domain_name, project_domain_name=project_domain_name, project_name=project_name ) if api_version == 2: client = keystone_client.Client(session=sess) else: client = keystone_client_v3.Client(session=sess) # This populates the client.service_catalog client.auth_ref = auth.get_access(sess) return client def get_keystone_session(self, keystone_ip, username, password, api_version=False, admin_port=False, user_domain_name=None, domain_name=None, project_domain_name=None, project_name=None): """Return a keystone session object""" ep = self.get_keystone_endpoint(keystone_ip, api_version=api_version, admin_port=admin_port) if api_version == 2: else: return (sess, auth) def get_keystone_endpoint(self, keystone_ip, api_version=None, admin_port=False): """Return keystone endpoint""" port = 5000 if admin_port: port = 35357 base_ep = "http://{}:{}".format(keystone_ip.strip().decode('utf-8'), port) if api_version == 2: ep = base_ep + "/v2.0" else: ep = base_ep + "/v3" return ep def get_default_keystone_session(self, keystone_sentry, openstack_release=None): """Return a keystone session object and client object assuming standard default settings Example call in amulet tests: self.keystone_session, self.keystone = u.get_default_keystone_session( self.keystone_sentry, openstack_release=self._get_openstack_release()) The session can then be used to auth other clients: neutronclient.Client(session=session) aodh_client.Client(session=session) eyc """ self.log.debug('Authenticating keystone admin...') api_version = 2 client_class = keystone_client.Client # 11 => xenial_queens if openstack_release and openstack_release >= 11: api_version = 3 client_class = keystone_client_v3.Client keystone_ip = keystone_sentry.info['public-address'] session, auth = self.get_keystone_session( keystone_ip, api_version=api_version, username='admin', password='openstack', project_name='admin', user_domain_name='admin_domain', project_domain_name='admin_domain') client = client_class(session=session) # This populates the client.service_catalog client.auth_ref = auth.get_access(session) return session, client

commit_message:
Suppress conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option

This patch fixes conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option.
To suppress this conflicts, when retry option selected this patch clears
auto_remove option and set readonly attribute for the checkbox.

Also, to check them easily from user, move auto_remove option from
Miscellaneous tab to Spec tab, i.e. under retry options.

Change-Id: I34a409141adf1ad822e5999240ccbb8ae8e2acf5
Closes-Bug: #1763250

commit_message:
Change runtimes to accept string

Currently the runtime is a drop down menu with only
"runc" option. User is not able to enter new runtimes
configured by them. So this patch changes the field to
accept any user input string for runtime.

Change-Id: I5e60dd782b799c013a492f823f144cfbe5fdfc15
(cherry picked from commit 288c26aad11e989520a21276cf187caedd2eeb7b)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I59d376c6da1afc0847a25893d80ca9a210bbe64b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Change ovs user and fix permissions on ovs upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-03 10:38:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/d23eacb0a3b9aa55c01af5db4da553c1ee76432a', 'message': 'Change ovs user and fix permissions on ovs upgrade

When upgrading to latest ovs, package needs to run with
ovs user, and also the affected folders need to change their perms.
Change the config file for it, and initially do a perm change. Also
create a one-time service file that will run after reboot, to be
sure that all the remaining folders have changed their perms
properly.

Change-Id: I0e103cb19a7bbaf951d233acfcb51086e57cf264
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-03 10:50:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/e7ff0b15379407d80e9e257d3b2f0aad44bd829a', 'message': 'Change ovs user and fix permissions on ovs upgrade

When upgrading to latest ovs, package needs to run with
ovs user, and also the affected folders need to change their perms.
Change the config file for it, and initially do a perm change. Also
create a one-time service file that will run after reboot, to be

commit_message:
Change ovs user and fix permissions on ovs upgrade

When upgrading to latest ovs, package needs to run with
ovs user, and also the affected folders need to change their perms.
Change the config file for it, and initially do a perm change. Also
create a one-time service file that will run after reboot, to be
sure that all the remaining folders have changed their perms
properly.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Change-Id: I0e103cb19a7bbaf951d233acfcb51086e57cf264
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/71/558471/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # first check if ovs needs upgrade OVS_NEEDS_UPGRADE=$(yum check-upgrade openvswitch | awk '/openvswitch/{print}') if [ -z "${OVS_NEEDS_UPGRADE}" ]; then echo "Looks like newer version of openvswitch is already installed, skipping" else if rpm -qa | grep "^openvswitch-2.5.0-14" || rpm -q --scripts openvswitch | awk '/postuninstall/,/*/' | grep "systemctl.*try-restart" ; then echo "Manual upgrade of openvswitch - ovs-2.5.0-14 or restart in postun detected" rm -rf OVS_UPGRADE mkdir OVS_UPGRADE && pushd OVS_UPGRADE echo "Attempting to downloading latest openvswitch with yumdownloader" yumdownloader --resolve openvswitch for pkg in $(ls -1 *.rpm); do break done popd # change the config for ovs user sed -i 's/^\#*OVS_USER_ID=.*/OVS_USER_ID="openvswitch:hugetlbfs"/' /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch # change permissions of files chown -R openvswitch:hugetlbfs /etc/openvswitch /var/run/openvswitch /var/log/openvswitch # create a one-time service file, that will change any remaining permissions after reboot cat >/etc/systemd/system/multi-user.target.wants/fix-ovs-permissions.service <<EOL [Unit] Description=One time service to fix permissions in OpenvSwitch After=network.target Before=openvswitch.service [Service] Type=oneshot User=root ExecStart=/usr/bin/chown -R openvswitch:hugetlbfs /etc/openvswitch /var/run/openvswitch /var/log/openvswitch ExecStartPost=/usr/bin/rm /etc/systemd/system/multi-user.target.wants/fix-ovs-permissions.service TimeoutStartSec=0 RemainAfterExit=no [Install] WantedBy=default.target EOL chmod a+x /etc/systemd/multi-user.target.wants/fix-ovs-permissions.service else echo "Skipping manual upgrade of openvswitch - no restart in postun detected" fi
deleted_lines: if rpm -qa | grep "^openvswitch-2.5.0-14" || rpm -q --scripts openvswitch | awk '/postuninstall/,/*/' | grep "systemctl.*try-restart" ; then echo "Manual upgrade of openvswitch - ovs-2.5.0-14 or restart in postun detected" rm -rf OVS_UPGRADE mkdir OVS_UPGRADE && pushd OVS_UPGRADE echo "Attempting to downloading latest openvswitch with yumdownloader" yumdownloader --resolve openvswitch for pkg in $(ls -1 *.rpm); do if rpm -U --test $pkg 2>&1 | grep "already installed" ; then echo "Looks like newer version of $pkg is already installed, skipping" else fi done popd else echo "Skipping manual upgrade of openvswitch - no restart in postun detected" fi

commit_message:
Add Ironic Networking Baremetal Templates

Ironic neutron agent will be installed on controller nodes, or
networker nodes, when environments/services/ironic.yaml or
environments/services-docker/ironic.yaml is used.

It should also be enabled on undercloud.

Also enables ``baremetal`` ML2 mechanism driver on undercloud.

Depends-On: Ic1f44414e187393d35e1382a42d384760d5757ef
Depends-On: I3c40f84052a41ed440758b971975c5c81ace4225
Change-Id: I0b4ef83a5383ff9726f6d69e0394fc544c381a7e

commit_message:
Change runtimes to accept string

Currently the runtime is a drop down menu with only
"runc" option. User is not able to enter new runtimes
configured by them. So this patch changes the field to
accept any user input string for runtime.

Change-Id: I5e60dd782b799c013a492f823f144cfbe5fdfc15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun-ui refs/changes/26/549726/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: placeholder: gettext("The runtime to create container with."),
deleted_lines: var runtimes = [ {value: "", name: gettext("Select runtime.")}, {value: "runc", name: gettext("runc")} ]; type: "select", titleMap: runtimes

commit_message:
Optimizing big 'on-XXX' clauses

* Fixed the implementation of data_flow.evaluate_task_outbound_context
  method so that it doesn't use copy.deepcopy() because it may be
  very expensive (both CPU and RAM) on big dictionaries.

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

commit_message:
Add the missing mds and mgr groups into site.yml

Add the ceph-mds and ceph-mgr host group into site.yml,
or the deploy action will be failed when ceph-mds and ceph-mgr is
different from the other ceph groups.

Change-Id: If34483c4a2e8f29b449ced811dd4b42e5b2e7dd4

commit_message:
Change ha_state property to always return a value

Right now, ha_state could return any value that is in
the state file, or even '' if the file is empty.  Instead,
return 'unknown' if it's empty.

We also need to update the translation map in the HA code
to deal with this new value to avoid a KeyError.

Related-bug: #1755243

Change-Id: I94a39e574cf4ff5facb76df352c14cbaba793e98

commit_message:
Rehome unstable_test decorator

The unstable_test decorator is used in both neutron and
neutron-tempest-plugin trees, so lets move to neutron-lib.

Change-Id: Ieba747097b6e2afbfbe2c71d395217574d679c9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/02/560102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """Test functions.""" import functools def unstable_test(reason): """Decorator used to mark test as unstable, on failure test will be skipped :param reason: String used in explanation, for example, 'bug 123456'. """ def decor(f): @functools.wraps(f) def inner(self, *args, **kwargs): try: return f(self, *args, **kwargs) except Exception as e: msg = ("%s was marked as unstable because of %s, " "failure was: %s") % (self.id(), reason, e) raise self.skipTest(msg) return inner return decor

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-16 21:58:22.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts_spec.rb', 'manifests/logging.pp', 'manifests/db/sync.pp', 'manifests/db/sync_api.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_db_online_data_migrations_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/nova-manage-user-16e7145d0c10bf57.yaml', 'manifests/cell_v2/map_cell0.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_cell_v2_map_cell_and_hosts_spec.rb', 'manifests/db/online_data_migrations.pp', 'manifests/cell_v2/discover_hosts.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_cell_v2_map_cell0_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/nova_logging_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/nova_cell_v2_map_instances.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/nova.rb', 'manifests/params.pp', 'manifests/cell_v2/map_cell_and_hosts.pp', 'manifests/cron/archive_deleted_rows.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_db_sync_spec.rb', 'manifests/cell_v2/map_instances.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_cron_archive_deleted_rows_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/nova_db_sync_api_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/482bf9695fb49c9bc59785510978cd2f973b3bba', 'message': "Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

commit_message:
Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>
Closes-Bug: #1671681
Change-Id: I0ca0110cbf9139c79074cf603dcab9135f96e765
(cherry picked from commit e128ba6538eb806589ebc01c16ee5e298bb0ee86)
(cherry picked from commit 0d6f9e10749959b0fe88c876319ca03ddac1b34e)

commit_message:
Use tripleo-upgrade role in undercloud upgrades job.

Featureset047 includes all needed parameters
to run an undercloud upgrade using the
tripleo-upgrade role.

Change toci_gate_test.sh logic to include the
mixed_upgrade environment file *-undercloud-*-overcloud.yml
only when overcloud-deploy is being performed. Otherwise,
it will try to load it for undercloud upgrade too.

Closes-Bug: #1735792
Depends-On: Ib204c89ad88ae4581e556710976325c2b2723039
Change-Id: Iaed38c620f39b66b0b560ae561580dce21ea199b

commit_message:
Remove vifs upon teardown

Since we removed the ability for nova to cleanly remove
the vif during teardown because that created a race condition,
the removal of all vif attachment records only seems to be the
right thing to do since we can't realistically change nova try
harder, and functionally we are otherwise looking at massive
locking changes.

Removing vif records is the lesser evil until we can reach
consensus on completely revamping locking to allow for greater
concurrency.

Change-Id: I8d683d2d506c97535b5a8f9a5de4c070c7e887df
Story: #1743652
Task: #9275
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/48/556748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Adds the behavior to remove all records of VIF attachments upon the teardown of a deployed node. This is in order to resolve issues related to where it is operationally impossible in some circumstances to remove a VIF attachment while a node is being undeplyed as the Compute service will only attempt to remove the VIF for five minutes. See `bug 1743652 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1743652>`_ for more details.

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement in lower-constraints

Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds in the
requirements files.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: Ibeba206f66dc5349de23ece82da101cbd99fa738

commit_message:
remove ec2 in service and cmd

ec2 was deprecated in commit
f098398a836e3671c49bb884b4a1a1988053f4b2
back to mitaka release, this patch
starts to remove ec2 services in nova.

Change-Id: I5939ef73904f1bb66ed8453c900bfb50cdb5b8b6

subject: Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-10 21:07:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/470e1bd1e42bfeb4da59e9048894be142f4cd25d', 'message': "Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687
(cherry picked from commit dd93b0c7190681620c3eed9937462901da42c7c4)
"}]
commit_message:
Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687
(cherry picked from commit dd93b0c7190681620c3eed9937462901da42c7c4)

commit_message:
Re-order items in policy.json

Grouped similar items into create/get/update/delete
order so they are easier to find, as some were even
in separate blocks.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I283cd31fadf26f00fb18ccffea19a6b59d4277a1

commit_message:
exclude eventlet 0.21.0

We previously indicated that 0.21.0 caused issues, so let's exclude it
from consideration.

Change-Id: I7f564818330a4a60c117895bd40c2ccd69ae4e68
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ia15b42216c52e177d7fdf275ecb05b383c403a92
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add negative test for live migration

Live migrate also moves a server from one host to another.
https://developer.openstack.org/api-guide/compute/server_concepts.html#server-actions

Change-Id: I31b9152667d574216849cdaceb2b0006e19c8e03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/24/533524/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('5b6f6582-f9bf-11e7-9c6c-fa163e65f5ce') def test_live_block_migration_to_same_host(self): server = self.create_test_server(wait_until="ACTIVE") server_details = self.admin_servers_client.show_server(server['id']) target_host = server_details['server']['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'] self.assertRaises(lib_exc.BadRequest, self._migrate_server_to, server['id'], target_host) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.servers_client, server['id'], 'ACTIVE') @decorators.attr(type=['negative'])

commit_message:
Fix wrapping of neutron forbidden error

In neutronv2 api, the neutron forbidden error is not wrapped
correctly. The exception class expects the first parameter as
the error message but an exception object is passed.

Closes-Bug: #1720726
Change-Id: I6e88333427ec2befe2122274b02775f013404e30
(cherry picked from commit f1a0557da4fbd7baa9196cb5c0ccdd7ebb16ecdf)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/560088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E266 too many leading '#' for block comment
- E501 line too long
- H903  Windows style line endings not allowed in code

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py
    neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_timestamp.py

Change-Id: I1fd3357479bb2ba3d89de92739ffac99900761b6
(cherry picked from commit 7a714aeb13e99b95a8f495765a1fa57297f92d30)
(cherry picked from commit 71b305cb9e0618000b84e6eef8cc5aa9ecf8848c)

commit_message:
Add warning for nova_catalog_admin_info option

The nova_catalog_admin_info option has been deprecated, but no warning.
So add warning for it.

Change-Id: I5c625a4640542ba109bb7048ede5676837ad487b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/35/560235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if $nova_catalog_admin_info { warning('The nova_catalog_admin_info parameter has been deprecated and will be removed in the future release.') }

commit_message:
Add Octavia v2 tempest plugin jobs to Octavia

This patch adds the tempest API and scenario jobs from
octavia-tempest-plugin to the Octavia gates list.

Initially in non-voting to gauge stability.

Change-Id: Ifca0d1e0e99424d13752694b5e9c4c5731c3ea95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/02/541002/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Scenario] Enable "qos-fip" network extension in tempest config

It is required to run FloatingIP QoS scenario test in test jobs
which uses legacy zuul playbooks (like dvr-multinode job for example)

Change-Id: Id3e94383bc385176e1b19a9c2f64fe29026b59e2

commit_message:
tox: cleanup targets

This makes tox code easier to manage and
allows for further refactoring.

Test commands are now reused between
similar tox targets instead of duplicating them.

Change-Id: I3552a8736c1d71d34efc94ebdcb609b7eb13114d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/78/499978/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # do not put any non essential commands on root testenv because other # envs will probably reuse it. It should contain commands valid for ALL envs. rm# By default ostestr will set concurrency # to ncpu, to specify something else use # the concurrency=<n> option. # call ie: 'tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=4' commands = {[testenv]commands} ostestr {posargs} py35: python3.5commands = {[testenv:functional]commands}commands = {[testenv:functional]commands} {[testenv]commands}
deleted_lines: # By default ostestr will set concurrency # to ncpu, to specify something else use # the concurrency=<n> option. # call ie: 'tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=4' ostestr {posargs}whitelist_externals = rm py35: python3.5whitelist_externals = rm

commit_message:
DRBD: Use the ClientHelper class to reduce amount of code

The DRBD Manage' DrbdManageClientHelp class is designed to accumulate
code that is common across various DRBD Manage clients; using this
shared code eases maintenance.

Depends-On: I4d8bb80f72db6fafc5f37e0e9a32d7ad7d11e87e

Change-Id: Iafb239781ff04b77f88311fa87cfb8edffe3f6e7

commit_message:
RBD: Create incremental backup for volume in-use failed

If we create backup for volume  in-use, volume
driver will clone a temporary volume, and create
a snapshot based on the temporary volume, then
create backup for the snapshot. So, the src_name
passed to method _rbd_diff_transfer should be the
name of the temporary volume instead of the original
volume's name. In order to get this name, we also need
add self.name to class os_brick.initiator.linuxrbd.RBDVolume.
This patch is accosiates with patch

Co-Authored-By: Hanxi_Liu <hanxi.liu@easystack.cn>
Depends-on: Ic2732e985b75ae710da3814c2d5b2253ced74534
Change-Id: I544c608493a565ce4b42d9e8d23199a44b34668c
Closes-Bug: #1663504

In order to get this name, we add self.name # to class os_brick.initiator.linuxrbd.RBDVolume. # if a volume is not in-use, the volume_file.rbd_image.name # is same as volume_name. self._rbd_diff_transfer(volume_file.rbd_image.name, rbd_pool, base_name,

commit_message:
Create eagerzeroedthick volume

EagerZeroeThick volume creation need long time.
EagerZeroeThick volume should be created after
volume creation api called.

Change-Id: I300f53a933a598d4f0a3cd3e14c40fc209e786fe
Closes-bug: #1739390

commit_message:
Use new ceph/daemon tags

The newer naming scheme replaces 'tag' with an actual version
number and appends the target architecture to the tag name.

Ultimately it allows us to pin to 'known to work' builds of the
images.

Change-Id: If080fa40f674cb9254f2b411c59f88ac54c74d12
(cherry picked from commit 74f70b7a33fe7589cdb28ab44235f83aa5cda158)

commit_message:
Create backup without configuring rbd_user.

If ceph cluster does not use any authentication, then we can
configure cinder.conf without option 'rbd_user'. When creating
backup or restoring, if the 'src_user' or 'dest_user' is None,
use 'admin' as default user, or it will report an error.
Closes-Bug: #1658623

Change-Id: Ic9cc4f694048e274ff3d204d349c95cdf7e64176
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/36/424036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If not configure rbd_user, use 'admin' as default, or it may # report an error. if not src_user: src_user = 'admin' if not dest_user: dest_user = 'admin'

subject: ibm_volume_driver: Make ds8k default proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-10 10:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/ibm_storage/ibm_storage.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/46422e84bcba75cfa14ff567c97bf3bf266e1699', 'message': 'ibm_volume_driver: Make ds8k default proxy

The given default is an invalid configuration. It pointed to the common proxy class
which is missing somne parameters in its constructor.

A default should have a sane value. Therfore this patch sets it to the ds8k proxy.

Change-Id: I6c4ca39362d80b71205a9d8f8372e91990e74a0f
'}]
commit_message:
ibm_volume_driver: Make ds8k default proxy

The given default is an invalid configuration. It pointed to the common proxy class
which is missing somne parameters in its constructor.

A default should have a sane value. Therfore this patch sets it to the ds8k proxy.

Change-Id: I6c4ca39362d80b71205a9d8f8372e91990e74a0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/81/532481/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch service capabilities to ovo

The c-vol currently sends service capabilities to c-sch in dict form.
We need convert it from dict blob to Oslo Versioned object notation.
This is important so that capabilities are supporting backporting in
case of rolling-upgrades

Change-Id: I1586c2b2b20c92724ca931d9aeb6b60c8d19ef97
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects
Depends-On: Iab6156cc25f78e8f80b220bc93c2b2e4974a585a
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wróblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/40/319040/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Intel Corporation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_versionedobjects import fields from cinder import objects from cinder.objects import base CONF = cfg.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @base.CinderObjectRegistry.register class Capabilities(base.CinderObject, base.CinderObjectDictCompat, base.CinderComparableObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'driver_version': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'filter_function': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'goodness_function': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'pools': fields.DictOfStringsField(nullable=True), 'sparse_copy_volume': fields.BooleanField(default=False, nullable=True), 'storage_protocol': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'vendor_name': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'volume_backend_name': fields.StringField(nullable=True) } @property def pools(self): pitems = [MetadataObject(k, v) for k, v in self.pools.items()] return pitems @pools.setter def pools(self, value): pitems = {d['key']: d['value'] for d in value} self.pools = pitems @classmethod def from_primitives(cls, capg): """Returns Capabilities object creating it from legacy dictionary. FIXME(karthikp): This should go away in early O as we stop supporting backward compatibility with M. """ cap = capg.copy() cap_obj = cls() pools = cap.pop('pools', {}) cap_obj.pools = pools for k, v in cap.items(): setattr(cap_obj, k, v) return cap_obj

subject: Refactoring total_capacity_gb & free_capacity_gb in capabilities
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-22 16:43:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8757935fd9d5f51d0009fa52642010f2764195e5', 'message': "Refactoring total_capacity_gb & free_capavity_gb in capabilities

Currently some drivers can report total_capacity_gb &
free_capacity_gb in service capabilities with values 'infinite' &
'unknown'. Since these fields are mostly having float values, it
creates problems when we are trying to structure service capabilities
as ovo.

This change mandates all drivers to use values of 'inf' & 'NaN'
instead of 'infinite' & 'unknown' respectively. 'inf' and 'NaN'
can be type casted to float but 'infinite & 'unknown' cannot

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3681415654c25f8a6c4dec838a62831f7ae35b13

commit_message:
Refactoring total_capacity_gb & free_capacity_gb in capabilities

Currently some drivers can report total_capacity_gb &
free_capacity_gb in service capabilities with values 'infinite' &
'unknown'. Since these fields are mostly having float values, it
creates problems when we are trying to structure service capabilities
as ovo.

This change mandates all drivers to use values of 'inf' & 'NaN'
instead of 'infinite' & 'unknown' respectively. 'inf' and 'NaN'
can be type casted to float but 'infinite & 'unknown' cannot

Closes-bug: #1629143
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3681415654c25f8a6c4dec838a62831f7ae35b13

commit_message:
Adding unit tests for cinder volume driver methods

This unit tests the copy_volume_to_image & _update_pools_and_stats
methods of the baseVD base classes used by LVM

Change-Id: Ibabcb3e223344056198781d187202caf7ca0c3fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/83/443383/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test__update_pools_and_stats(self): """Test function for _update_pools_and_stats""" # Testing to see it pools info is not existing fake_data = {"volume_backend_name": 'fake_backend', "vendor_name": 'Open Source', "driver_version": 'version', "storage_protocol": "v1.0", "pools": []} self.volume.driver._update_pools_and_stats(fake_data) self.assertEqual('fake_backend', self.volume.driver._stats['pools'][0] ['pool_name']) self.assertTrue(len(self.volume.driver._stats['pools']), 1) # Testing to see if pools info is already existing self.volume.driver.pools = [{'pool_name': 'fake', 'total_capacity_gb': 'infinite', 'consistencygroup_support': False, 'QoS_support': False, 'provisioned_capacity_gb': 0, 'goodness_function': None, 'replication_enabled': False, 'reserved_percentage': 100, 'filter_function': None, 'free_capacity_gb': 'infinite'}] self.volume.driver._update_pools_and_stats(fake_data) self.assertTrue(len(self.volume.driver._stats['pools']), 2) @mock.patch.object(image_utils, 'upload_volume') def test_copy_volume_to_image(self, mock_upload_volume): """Test function for copy_volume_to_image""" vol = tests_utils.create_volume(self.context) image_service = mock.MagicMock() image_meta = mock.MagicMock() value = vol['name'].replace('-', '--') path = '/dev/mapper/cinder--volumes-%s' % value self.volume.driver.copy_volume_to_image( self.context, vol, image_service, image_meta) mock_upload_volume.assert_called_once_with(self.context, image_service, image_meta, path) volume_id="123", volume_type="abc")

commit_message:
sphinxext: Use 'sphinx.util.logging'

This resolves a deprecation warning. It also allows us to stop passing
around the 'app' variable just to enable logging.

Change-Id: I7b7e29ae6dec086373bbaeb2ebaae5ed7e9628b1

commit_message:
Change testenv from py34 to py35

- The Zuul gate currently only support py35.
- In setup.cfg, the project said that it support
Programming Language :: Python :: 3.5.

Therefor, this patch changes py34 to py35.

Change-Id: Iaad9bf41e3c8a8915c06ff039e570a2cc41ca2a1

commit_message:
eventletutils: Fix behavior discrepency when reusing Events

The threading.Event object allows calling set() multiple times, but
the eventlet.Event object only permits send() to be called once,
before a reset() is required to reuse the Event.

Calling eventletutils.Event.set() multiple times triggers an
AssertionError from eventlet.Event.  This change resets the underlying
eventlet.Event if the set() method had already been called previously,
and ensures the eventletutils.Event behaves the same as the
threading.Event.

Change-Id: If761b237266bbfe7e65c56e152074b5d1ccac74b

commit_message:
Enforce env_variables values to string before run

Converts extra_env_variables values to string because processutils
expect them to be so.

Change-Id: If033001d53f9163ef998fcd162dff1b76fb586d7
Closes-Bug: #1761232
(cherry picked from commit 242b6714e6fad9111440b5413bcbc66427c4bc72)

commit_message:
Update gabbi to 1.42.0 for sake of heat

The heat tempest plugin has a situation where it is important to
be able to list tests when the target host is unknown. This was
impossible with gabbi<1.42.0, so this updates the upper contraint
to 1.42.0, which provides the required functionality.

Change-Id: Ie0dce3570e1459b68571ce3e5a404299786b1359
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561709/

commit_message:
Remove redundant _do_check_can_live_migrate_destination

This was added in change I8c2f1a67 with the note:

===
We'll want to add claims around the logic of this method, so it's better
if there is a nested method that does the business logic to
avoid deep nesting that makes the code less readable.
===

AFAICT this logic was never added, and the indirection has always been
redundant.

Change-Id: Ie01f2c056a85e08a46c2461f1952cfdbaac3a547

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iada24c34d3d5c6ef75ed59d3567f970119308640
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use https for stackviz get

We are noticing on nb03 that the curl get of this file fails; but it
starts working when you use https.  Switch to it.

Change-Id: I5fef4281547758f484cd8a93326b0cfeb790762a

commit_message:
Deduplicate notification samples Rocky - 2

This patch refactors the sample files of:

* instance-resize-start
* instance-resize-end
* instance-resize-error
* instance-resize_finish-start
* instance-resize_finish-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionPayload sample data.

Change-Id: I4b3728a18d604f07ebffe45eec457e47bba98b7e

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ia57e373aed0982340ca7f2f37801f5218a0c394e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Correct permissions on the nova logfiles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-16 18:51:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/57362117dbb972a9779c57c4e02e74d16835d087', 'message': "Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

commit_message:
Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>
Closes-Bug: #1671681
Change-Id: I0ca0110cbf9139c79074cf603dcab9135f96e765
(cherry picked from commit e128ba6538eb806589ebc01c16ee5e298bb0ee86)

subject: Switch to ubuntu-minimal for default amphora image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 20:40:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/a53e98ca772a9cdad83312159fcf28dceacf4549', 'message': 'Switch to ubuntu-minimal for default amphora image

Previously we were using the "ubuntu" diskimage-builder base element as the
default base OS to build the amphora image.
The "ubuntu" element is based on the ubuntu cloud image. This image includes
packages we do not need for the amphora image. At this point it's not clear
that Ubuntu will ship an 18.04 LTS cloud image in the format the "ubuntu"
element requires.
This patch switches the default Ubuntu amphora image to build with the
"ubuntu-minimal" diskimage-builder element.

Change-Id: I84a85ca1363bce2e0f13da64540ec7ba3575e818
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-06 23:07:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/2aeb900dc4ad01dafd2de857f7c2aecb1352d9ba', 'message': 'Switch to ubuntu-minimal for default amphora image

Previously we were using the "ubuntu" diskimage-builder base element as the
default base OS to build the amphora image.
The "ubuntu" element is based on the ubuntu cloud image. This image includes
packages we do not need for the amphora image. At this point it's not clear
that Ubuntu will ship an 18.04 LTS cloud image in the format the "ubuntu"
element requires.
This patch switches the default Ubuntu amphora image to build with the
"ubuntu-minimal" diskimage-builder element.

It also sets up support for Ubuntu 18.04 (bionic beaver) and HAProxy 1.8.

Change-Id: I84a85ca1363bce2e0f13da64540ec7ba3575e818

commit_message:
Switch to ubuntu-minimal for default amphora image

Previously we were using the "ubuntu" diskimage-builder base element as the
default base OS to build the amphora image.
The "ubuntu" element is based on the ubuntu cloud image. This image includes
packages we do not need for the amphora image. At this point it's not clear
that Ubuntu will ship an 18.04 LTS cloud image in the format the "ubuntu"
element requires.
This patch switches the default Ubuntu amphora image to build with the
"ubuntu-minimal" diskimage-builder element.

This patch also moves the amphora agent into a virtual environment inside
the amphora.

It also sets up support for Ubuntu 18.04 (bionic beaver) and HAProxy 1.8.

Change-Id: I84a85ca1363bce2e0f13da64540ec7ba3575e818
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/16/559416/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: Block swap volume attempts with encrypted volumes prior to Queens

Prior to Queens any attempt to swap between encrypted volumes would
result in unencrypted data being written to the new volume. This
unencrypted data would then be overwritten the next time the volume was
attached to an instance as Nova no longer identified the volume as
encrypted, resulting in the volume being reformatted.

This stable only change uses limited parts of the following changes to
block all swap_volume attempts with encrypted volumes prior to Queens
where this was resolved by Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18 and also
blocked when using QEMU to decrypt LUKS volumes by
Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1.

Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022

The request context is provided to swap_volume in order to look up the
encryption metadata of a volume.

Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

Attempts to swap from an encrypted volume are blocked with a
NotImplementedError exception raised.

I258127fdcd011ccec721d5ff62eb7f128f130336

Attempts to swap from an unencrypted volume to an encrypted volume are
also blocked with a NotImplementedError exception raised.

Ie02d298cd92d5b5ebcbbcd2b0e8be01f197bfafb

The serial of a volume is used as the id if connection_info for the
volume doesn't contain the volume_id key. Required to avoid bug #1746609.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: If12e7860baad2899380f06144a0270784a5466b8

commit_message:
Move LIBS_FROM_GIT check to apply more broadly

All current known uses of LIBS_FROM_GIT installations use setup_develop,
but in case other situations arise in the future, move the check
to _setup_package_with_constraints_edit which is used by several other
installation methods.

Change-Id: Ifb21fd7d666e219299d65be97a13fb8300a64169
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/13/559113/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If this project is in LIBS_FROM_GIT, verify it was actually installed # correctly. This helps catch errors caused by constraints mismatches. if use_library_from_git "$project_dir"; then if ! lib_installed_from_git "$project_dir"; then die $LINENO "The following LIBS_FROM_GIT was not installed correctly: $project_dir" fi fi
deleted_lines: # If this project is in LIBS_FROM_GIT, verify it was actually installed # correctly. This helps catch errors caused by constraints mismatches. if use_library_from_git "$project_dir"; then if ! lib_installed_from_git "$project_dir"; then die $LINENO "The following LIBS_FROM_GIT was not installed correctly: $project_dir" fi fi

commit_message:
Correct the string formatting in a info log message

It should be "%s," not just "%,". The error observed was something
like...

ValueError: unsupported format character ',' (0x2c) at index 91

Closes-Bug: #1764696
Change-Id: I601c8640cec857746c2c17f94116da890f4d65e0

commit_message:
Update prepare using an environment file

We'll be using t-h-t environment files to insert and remove no-ops in
the plan/stack. This should help make the update/upgrade Mistral
workflows more release-agnostic and thus reduce the risk of bugs in
mixed-release UC/OC enviornments.

Depends-On: I486ad0d44f105a6fa9fd24dcf7ac28d40ceecc27
Change-Id: If173d5f6e0be71f467bd062627e9f17e8b684b99
(cherry picked from commit d5c58c246564f05dd7c9fc189bf8f87e05442140)

commit_message:
Fix gate issues

NOTE(mriedem/smatzek): This is a squash of two commits.

The first commit message is:

Jobs run as jenkins on Zuul v2 but run as user zuul on Zuul v3.

NOTE(mriedem): This is only taking one specific fix from the large
change on master (queens) since we don't need the other changes
for stable/pike to fix the gate.

(cherry picked from commit 9ec134996a1162de0d74ef915dc138bbacbcfdf1)

This is the 2nd commit message:

Increase the TROVE_AGENT_CALL_HIGH_TIMEOUT to
help the upgrade test pass. The upgrade test has an agent call
that takes longer than the current timeout when running in
the gate on Nova compute with virt_type set as qemu.

NOTE(smatzek): This is only taking one fix from this change as
the other is N/A in this case as it was enabling the disabled
integration tests.

(cherry picked from commit d7b773d2b07f0c95909ef73c4644a63f09fd82c3)

Change-Id: Ic55187b0d73d4c572d7f8332882b4f455a6177c8
(cherry picked from commit e6d4b4b3fe1768348c9df815940b97cecb5e7ee2)

commit_message:
Fix mysql instance create failed when enable skip-name-resolve

In the guestagent code, it create os_admin user only grant
privileges on host:localhost, but use host:127.0.0.1 to
connect to mysql. Modify host privileges grant on to 127.0.0.1
to avoid create instance failed when enable skip-name-resolve
in config file.

Change-Id: Ifa69461c8a55464f88aec001d067450eedccf172
Closes-bug: #1729225
(cherry picked from commit 43c545ac84f29908a2e5396d07bd3de38e3a1101)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/42/518642/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable longer Keystone token life

The devstack plugin sets a 3 hour Keystone token life
but Keystone is already running when this configuration change
is called so Keystone still runs with the default for the tests.

Add a restart of Keystone to enable the longer life.

Change-Id: Ie340b1c0b56652fc9ca4c0981468363c1be9fb25
(cherry picked from commit a3514d84208d0244bb3a8aa3fc76092349c40115)

commit_message:
Open the volume_support of redis

In the past, we support volume_support when we support
redis-cluster[1], but we did not update to conf[2].
we are making the sample conf files match the
default configuration in code.

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203702/
[2]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107117/

Closes-Bug: #1701469
Change-Id: I428e274fdb85621b21453780e90a8a0ab401ffd9
(cherry picked from commit 5b7930446f5d1ea0bd663aeb9070f35925dced50)

commit_message:
Microversion 2.61 - support extra_specs in flavor API

Starting from microversion 2.61, the responses of the 'Flavor' APIs
include the 'extra_specs' parameter. Therefore 'Flavors extra-specs'
(os-extra_specs) API calls have been removed in the following commands
since microversion 2.61.

* nova flavor-list
* nova flavor-show

Change-Id: I10d621d9b62764114d55cb368e720d182eaffd11
Implements: blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/20/561520/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def assert_not_called(self, method, url, body=None): return self.shell.cs.assert_not_called(method, url, body) self.assertNotIn('extra_specs', out) self.assert_not_called('GET', '/flavors/aa1/os-extra_specs') self.assertNotIn('extra_specs', out) def test_flavor_list_with_extra_specs_by_default(self): """Tests that the extra_specs column is added by default for version >= 2.61. """ out, _ = self.run_command('flavor-list', api_version='2.61') self.assert_not_called('GET', '/flavors/aa1/os-extra_specs') self.assert_called_anytime('GET', '/flavors/detail') self.assertIn('Description', out) self.assertIn('extra_specs', out) def test_flavor_list_with_extra_specs_2_61_or_later(self): self.assertRaises(SystemExit, self.run_command, 'flavor-list --extra-specs', api_version='2.61') self.assert_called('GET', '/flavors/1', pos=0) self.assert_called('GET', '/flavors/1/os-extra_specs', pos=1) def test_flavor_show_2_61_or_later(self): """Tests that the 'os-extra_specs' is not called in version >= 2.61.""" out, _ = self.run_command('flavor-show 1', api_version='2.61') self.assert_not_called('GET', '/flavors/1/os-extra_specs') self.assert_called_anytime('GET', '/flavors/1') self.assertIn('extra_specs', out) out, _ = self.run_command("flavor-delete 2") self.assertNotIn('extra_specs', out) def test_flavor_delete_extra_specs(self): """Tests that extra specs is shown when deleting a flavor.""" out, _ = self.run_command("flavor-delete 2", api_version='2.61') self.assert_called('DELETE', '/flavors/2') self.assertIn('extra_specs', out) out, _ = self.run_command("flavor-create description " "1234 512 10 1 --description foo", api_version='2.55') self.assertNotIn('extra_specs', out) def test_flavor_create_extra_specs(self): """Tests that a response includes extra specs when creating a flavor in the version 2.61 or later. """ out, _ = self.run_command("flavor-create flavorcreate " "1234 512 10 1 --swap 1024 --ephemeral 10 " "--is-public true", api_version='2.61') self.assert_called('POST', '/flavors', pos=-2) self.assert_called('GET', '/flavors/1', pos=-1) self.assertIn('extra_specs', out) def test_flavor_update_extra_specs(self): """Tests that a response includes extra spces when updating a flavor. """ out, _ = self.run_command( "flavor-update with-description new-description", api_version='2.61') expected_put_body = { "flavor": { "description": "new-description" } } self.assert_called('GET', '/flavors/with-description', pos=-2) self.assert_called('PUT', '/flavors/with-description', expected_put_body, pos=-1) self.assertIn('new-description', out) self.assertIn('extra_specs', out) 61, # There are no version-wrapped shell method changes for this.
deleted_lines: self.assert_called_anytime('GET', '/flavors/1') self.run_command("flavor-delete 2") self.run_command("flavor-create description " "1234 512 10 1 --description foo", api_version='2.55')

commit_message:
Remove mox in test_serversV21.py (1)

Replace stubs.Set for the following methods with mock in
nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_serversV21.py.

* nova.compute.api.API.get
* nova.compute.api.API.get_all

Subsequent patches will replace stubs.Set in test cases.

Change-Id: Ib0f55b40357cc714a9be9add76b0dc94169f1afc
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
Revert "NetApp ONTAP: Fix share size when creating from snapshot"

This reverts commit 1183b19f1c6e6e3fd15d35ebc845317165f4bf82.

This patch breaks the NetApp ONTAP driver when creating
shares from snapshots because there was no 'size' attribute
in ShareSnapshotInstance DB model back in Ocata.

Change-Id: I660925b1d3cad7407b5990dff3fb3dc926270c7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/75/561975/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: --- fixes: - The NetApp ONTAP driver has been fixed to honor the share size as requested when creating shares from an existing snapshot.

commit_message:
Activate another set of healthchecks

In previous patches link to appropriate scripts were not added.
This patch adds links related to following already merged patches:
 - I757d53189f5819bb3a0e7bebe277353f3460738d
 - I4a193d7ce1c455da2865498470ed3b98160df112
 - Ie8eaab9919bde61793a3310328ee9f117c4e58da
 - Ief543580e6b717bb9dba62b19ffe12aff5395ff9

This patch also adds exec permission to some of the healthchecks
added in above patches.

Change-Id: Id5dc7d169301e45cb0abab7cecae67457db9fd96

subject: Improve exponential backoff for wrap_db_retry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-12 10:25:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/ae6789b61dd184c93975e63c43d0b8996174a80c', 'message': 'Improve exponential backoff for wrap_db_retry

The @oslo_db.api.wrap_db_retry is used for db.api methods
retrying. If db_error raised, the decorator help us to call
the api methods again after a few seconds(accurately, is
2**retry_times seconds).

If the db_error is deadlock error, the old wrap_db_retry
is not so suitable anymore. As we know, some deadlocks cause
because we call some methods(transactions) concurrently. If
we only retry after stable 2**retry_times seconds, we will
recall the method concurrently again.

In order to minimize the chance of regenerating a deadlock
and reduce the average sleep time, we propose to add some
random jitter to the delay period by default when the
deadlock error is detected.

Change-Id: I206745708570f1f292529ff58eee9b83fc09a9f2
Closes-bug: to be add
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-13 03:48:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/618de6e60b1fbd3d1d16444d8a048c9677e57b12', 'message': 'Improve exponential backoff for wrap_db_retry

because we call some methods(transactions) concurrently. If

In order to minimize the chance of regenerating a deadlock

is not so suitable anymore. As we know, some deadlocks cause
because we call some methods(transactions) concurrently. If
we only retry after stable 2**retry_times seconds, we will
recall the method concurrently again.

In order to minimize the chance of regenerating a deadlock
and reduce the average sleep time, we propose to add some
random jitter to the delay period by default when the
deadlock error is detected.

Change-Id: I206745708570f1f292529ff58eee9b83fc09a9f2
Closes-bug: #1737869

commit_message:
Improve exponential backoff for wrap_db_retry

The @oslo_db.api.wrap_db_retry is used for db.api methods
retrying. If db_error raised, the decorator help us to call
the api methods again after a few seconds(accurately, is
2**retry_times seconds).

If the db_error is deadlock error, the old wrap_db_retry
is not so suitable anymore. As we know, some deadlocks cause
because we call some methods(transactions) concurrently. If
we only retry after stable 2**retry_times seconds, we will
recall the method concurrently again.

In order to minimize the chance of regenerating a deadlock
and reduce the average sleep time, we propose to add some
random jitter to the delay period by default when the
deadlock error is detected.

Change-Id: I206745708570f1f292529ff58eee9b83fc09a9f2
Closes-bug: #1737869
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/62/527362/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('oslo_db.api.wrap_db_retry._get_inc_interval') def test_retry_wrapper_deadlock(self, mock_get): @api.wrap_db_retry(max_retries=5, retry_on_deadlock=True) def some_method(): raise exception.DBDeadlock('test') self.assertRaises(exception.DBDeadlock, some_method) mock_get.assert_called() def test_wrap_db_retry_get_interval(self): x = api.wrap_db_retry(max_retries=5, retry_on_deadlock=True, max_retry_interval=11) self.assertEqual(True, x.exp_backoff) self.assertEqual(11, x.max_retry_interval) for i in (1, 2, 4): self.assertTrue(x._get_inc_interval(i) < 2 * i) for i in (8, 16, 32): self.assertTrue(x._get_inc_interval(i) <= x.max_retry_interval)

commit_message:
Extend config-grabbing magic to new oslo.config

Some changes (in what are admittedly private methods) from oslo.config
5.x to 6.x broke our hacky bits. These bits have now been adjusted to
be compatible with a wider range of oslo.config versions.

This delicate code must be maintained in order to support grabbing
config values from [keystone_authtoken], a behavior which is usually
discouraged.

Change-Id: I9aaa4a3e9052a61269bb7ffcc642383ad6c5a0d8
Story: 2001835
Task: 12598

commit_message:
Extend linters time out

Linters are extended to 15 minutes. A few jobs have been just
reaching the 10 minute deadline, so using 15 minutes should
leave plenty of wiggle room.

Change-Id: I1473d55498d72f5611ae09e0d2e7b709954bb363

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.12

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I593766652cc6131e2d74ed74b36fc7337caa228a

commit_message:
doc: BFV instances and IsolatedHostsFilter

Since BFV instances don't have a specific image attached to them, the
filter will consider them as not having a specific image, hence not
isolated. Correcting the doc.

Change-Id: Ib235fca1365ee7a38b94600960ee3947f448c4a9

commit_message:
Use 'timestamp' name consistently in ShardRange

The attr name is 'timestamp' but 'created_at' was used in the
constructor and serialized form. 'timestamp' is now used consistently,
since the time value is not specific to a creation event.

Change-Id: I116cd493a64bb296047bdc832ecbcf2d478bcdcc

commit_message:
Re-order database migrations

The database migration sequence currently implemented were
required for Newton->Ocata as cells v2 was being implemented.

Now that cells are in place already, we can simplify the
sequence of tasks. This also now happens to be necessary due
to changes in the Rocky API database.

Change-Id: I101e75f70a7c99ceb1129c9c224f6a303dfae771
Related-Bug: #1761775

commit_message:
Add APM Server

The elastic Stack has the ability to get application performance metrics
using the built in APM server. This change implements the APM server in
an existing ELK environment.

Change-Id: Ie6f533b81cfdb0c6a4ba2f33fd3b9f0a3e49a1fc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 17.0.3

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: Iad4572f75808c63c0d3fa1ec6bb5307fc51a074a
Change-Id: I6a79da037fcf7771868b034bb933c4e3758c7983

commit_message:
Add CREATE_FAILED as a failure state in magnum cluster tests

When the creation of a cluster fails with CREATE_FAILED it waits until
it hits the timeout and it should fail immediately

Change-Id: Ib0f5651720a15c7a276af71a58fbc6f289cb593b

commit_message:
Ensure openvswitch user exist before package update

Ovs uses openvswitch user when updating package to 2.8
onwards, but openvswitch user is not exist and will not
be created during package update. This is going to add
workaround to make sure openvswitch user exist before
running package update.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Change-Id: I913e56c676890c4071f60aa190d02bfaca264d76
(cherry picked from commit 1051fbe10b443801c96a4efaff7acc8697e3fa5d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/72/559472/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ovs uses openvswitch:hugetlbfs as user and group settings # when updating to 2.8 onwards, but openvswitch user is not # created during package update. This adds workaround to # make sure openvswitch user exist before running package # update. Details can be found at: # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1559374 # 42477 is the kolla hugetlbfs gid value. getent group hugetlbfs >/dev/null || \ groupadd hugetlbfs -g 42477 && groupmod -g 42477 hugetlbfs getent passwd openvswitch >/dev/null || \ useradd -r -d / -s /sbin/nologin -c "Open vSwitch Daemons" openvswitch usermod -a -G hugetlbfs openvswitch

commit_message:
Add upgrade-[prepare|converge].yaml into upgrade cli

This explicitly adds the upgrade-prepare.yaml environment file
or the upgrade-converge.yaml environment file, into the stored
swift plan, before continuing with the previous workflow (here
heat stack update in both cases). See dependency below in tht
and this tie-in is the biggest downside I can see.

The idea is to stop doing it in the tripleo-common like [1][2]
and move all the upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade cli to use the
same and include the expected environment file.

Co-Authored-By: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/6090d32b516f92837fc8b01b7a55dc97ed3e8a77/tripleo_common/actions/package_update.py#L62-L76
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/6090d32b516f92837fc8b01b7a55dc97ed3e8a77/tripleo_common/actions/plan.py#L492-L502
Depends-On: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c
Change-Id: I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2

commit_message:
Update converge workflow to remove no-ops

The no-opped DeploymentSteps need to be re-added after we're done with
minor update.

Related:
  python-tripleoclient I9656d8c6137fb656aecda7d13768ca4ab3c10b1f

revisions:

The collect_nodes_uuid parses ansible json output which might contain
spurious lines if additional output callbacks are enabled. This change
explicitly sets the callback whitelist to empty string before
lauching ansible-playbook to ensure only the json plugin is loaded.

Change-Id: Ic133f99988fcc4f6e20ef327b6f2e753c3fff394

(cherry picked from commit f2cef740910c5c449596b9f59d7bdfa2f126d0c2)

commit_message:
Force ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_WHITELIST to empty list for collect_nodes_uuid

The collect_nodes_uuid parses ansible json output which might contain
spurious lines if additional output callbacks are enabled. This change
explicitly sets the callback whitelist to empty string before
lauching ansible-playbook to ensure only the json plugin is loaded.

Change-Id: Ic133f99988fcc4f6e20ef327b6f2e753c3fff394
Closes-Bug: 1755539
(cherry picked from commit f2cef740910c5c449596b9f59d7bdfa2f126d0c2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/65/559965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #NOTE(gfidente): set ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_WHITELIST to empty string to avoid spurious output #in the json output. The publish: directive will in fact parse the output. extra_env_variables: ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_WHITELIST: ''

commit_message:
Resolve pep8 E402 errors and no longer ignore E402

Fix the pep8 E402 (Module level import not at top of file) errors.

For the Alembic files move the definitions of 'revision' and
'down_revision' below the imports. This is now done in Alembic [1]

For other files fix as needed by moving the imports or lines before
the imports.

In a few cases add a "# noqa E402" to whitelist the issue.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/alembic/commits/dc2aae0374b76ccab8494be6e103d84089bc449b

Change-Id: I48c96d5da0cb747b3ca3fceea9b4ffa85a9ebe22

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

About PrettyTable requirement:
The minimum version of PrettyTable is not correct in requirements.txt,
which should be 0.7.2 according to the unittests(before 0.7.2, if the
table is empty, i.e. no rows in the table, PrettyTable won't print the
headers and borders, this is changed during 0.7.2)

Co-Authored-By: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia9cadcbc2bc9aa2864fe47040dfe7be8ae286b98
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

recent version of rally-openstack

Add a new nodes configuration and featureset049 for Ceph

The new featureset aims at deploying Ceph in containers, use
network isolation on a single nic and Pacemaker.

commit_message:
Correct stack and add ceph_ansible_playbook in upgrade unittests.

The stack name being mocked was not matching
with the one used in the args. This didn't fail
because at the time of asserting mock_upgrade
we were passing still the wrong stack name, not
the one from the arguments.

This patch also adds the ceph_ansible_playbook
arg to verifylist.

Change-Id: I854ce652995c3381c389d5f4d7e6b68d881f78bb

commit_message:
Miscellaneous iSCSI improvements

This commit has changes for below 3 items.

1) It adds _get_iscsi_conn_props to process connection_info data for
   iSCSI properties.
2) It removes the target_name when creating scsi mapping because that's
   now being handled correctly at the platform level.
3) It adds more testing around 'CHAP' auth_method.

Change-Id: Ib6deef7b15bdb73a23f5edb5ec3fb6cbc9fe4e93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/22/561022/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_iscsi_conn_props(self): # Get the conn props with auth enabled vios_w = mock.MagicMock() props = self.vol_drv._get_iscsi_conn_props(vios_w, auth=True) expected_props = { 'target_iqn': self.iqn, 'target_lun': self.lun, 'target_portal': self.host_ip, 'auth_username': self.user, 'auth_password': self.password, 'auth_method': 'CHAP' } self.assertItemsEqual(expected_props, props) # Check with multipath enabled mprops = self.multi_vol_drv._get_iscsi_conn_props(vios_w, auth=True) multi_props = { 'discovery_auth_method': self.auth_method, 'discovery_auth_username': self.user, 'discovery_auth_password': self.password, 'target_iqns': [self.iqn], 'target_luns': [self.lun], 'target_portals': [self.host_ip] } multi_props.update(expected_props) self.assertItemsEqual(multi_props, mprops) # Call without auth props props = self.vol_drv._get_iscsi_conn_props(vios_w, auth=False) expected_props.pop('auth_username') expected_props.pop('auth_password') expected_props.pop('auth_method') self.assertItemsEqual(expected_props, props) # KeyError self.vol_drv.connection_info['data'].pop('target_iqn') props = self.vol_drv._get_iscsi_conn_props(vios_w, auth=False) self.assertIsNone(props)
