commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I60514447afcc2423821da4b5762f55056177874f

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I931fc5b5c5bd0b746e1600c93897a7551b3f559e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix help for subcommands on interactive shell
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-27 19:26:57.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/interactive.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cliff/commit/13ddbb57ce171cea3558df700e4cbf75459ec77c', 'message': "Fix help for subcommands on interactive shell

Using the latest cliff (2.11.0), I hit the
following bug running help on subcommands:

(myapp) help mysubcommand
... stack trace omitted for brevity ...
EXCEPTION of type 'AttributeError' occurred with message: ''InteractiveApp' object has no attribute 'parsed''

It does seem like cmd2.Cmd changed its interface
and now we don't have the .parse method anymore.
Let's handle both new and old interfaces.

Change-Id: I407be7f5ed2b6bbe10d5b817aae7598414bbbaa7
Signed-off-by: Lucas Meneghel Rodrigues <lookkas@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix help for subcommands on interactive shell

Using the latest cliff (2.11.0), I hit the
following bug running help on subcommands:

(myapp) help mysubcommand
... stack trace omitted for brevity ...
EXCEPTION of type 'AttributeError' occurred with message: ''InteractiveApp' object has no attribute 'parsed''

It does seem like cmd2.Cmd changed its interface
and now we don't have the .parse method anymore.
Let's handle both new and old interfaces.

Change-Id: I407be7f5ed2b6bbe10d5b817aae7598414bbbaa7
Signed-off-by: Lucas Meneghel Rodrigues <lookkas@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cliff refs/changes/97/548397/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hasattr(line, 'parsed'): line = line.parsed.raw line_parts = shlex.split(line) line = 'help %s' % arg parsed_method = getattr(self, 'parsed', None) if parsed_method is not None: line = parsed_method(line) self.default(line)

commit_message:
Deduplicate notification samples Rocky - 1

This patch refactors the sample files of:

* instance-rebuild-start
* instance-rebuild-end
* instance-rebuild-error
* instance-restore-start
* instance-resotre-end
* instance-resume-start
* instance-resume-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionPayload sample data.

Change-Id: I459c39a5dcb928ec3bb03fe144afa0f1ea82f95b

commit_message:
Functional test for regression bug #1713783

Add functional test for evacuation, when no valid host available.
Migration should end up in 'error' state.

Original patch is modified as in Ocata os-service API still uses
the old way of identifing services.

Also, due to bugfix of #1744325 the state of the server after a
failed evacuation is no longer ACTIVE rather ERROR.

Change-Id: I1adc20f2a5261e6906a18b9aee5cd2c8ecf0cf4d
Related-bug: #1713783
(cherry picked from commit 5687c170ea003aafa2720fb00af9d84836bb41df)
(cherry picked from commit e87d9f51abea0b1c97628ef02435157da4b334ec)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/505160/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 Ericsson # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import time from oslo_log import log as logging from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers from nova.tests.unit import fake_network from nova.tests.unit import fake_notifier import nova.tests.unit.image.fake from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class FailedEvacuateStateTests(test.TestCase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin): """Regression Tests for bug #1713783 When evacuation fails with NoValidHost, the migration status remains 'accepted' instead of 'error'. This causes problem in case the compute service starts up again and looks for migrations with status 'accepted', as it then removes the local instances for those migrations even though the instance never actually migrated to another host. """ microversion = 'latest' def setUp(self): super(FailedEvacuateStateTests, self).setUp() self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.PlacementFixture()) api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) self.api = api_fixture.admin_api self.api.microversion = self.microversion nova.tests.unit.image.fake.stub_out_image_service(self) self.start_service('conductor') self.start_service('scheduler') self.addCleanup(nova.tests.unit.image.fake.FakeImageService_reset) self.hostname = 'host1' self.compute1 = self.start_service('compute', host=self.hostname) fake_network.set_stub_network_methods(self) flavors = self.api.get_flavors() self.flavor1 = flavors[0] def _wait_for_notification_event_type(self, event_type, max_retries=10): retry_counter = 0 while True: if len(fake_notifier.NOTIFICATIONS) > 0: for notification in fake_notifier.NOTIFICATIONS: if notification.event_type == event_type: return if retry_counter == max_retries: self.fail('Wait for notification event type (%s) failed' % event_type) retry_counter += 1 time.sleep(0.5) def _boot_a_server(self): server_req = self._build_minimal_create_server_request( self.api, 'some-server', flavor_id=self.flavor1['id'], image_uuid='155d900f-4e14-4e4c-a73d-069cbf4541e6', networks='none') LOG.info('booting on %s', self.hostname) created_server = self.api.post_server({'server': server_req}) return self._wait_for_state_change( self.api, created_server, 'ACTIVE') def test_evacuate_no_valid_host(self): # Boot a server server = self._boot_a_server() # Force source compute down compute_id = self.api.get_services( host=self.hostname, binary='nova-compute')[0]['id'] self.api.put_service(compute_id, {'forced_down': 'true'}) fake_notifier.stub_notifier(self) fake_notifier.reset() # Initiate evacuation post = {'evacuate': {}} self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], post) self._wait_for_notification_event_type('compute_task.rebuild_server') server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') self.assertEqual(self.hostname, server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) # Check migrations migrations = self.api.get_migrations() self.assertEqual(1, len(migrations)) self.assertEqual('evacuation', migrations[0]['migration_type']) self.assertEqual(server['id'], migrations[0]['instance_uuid']) self.assertEqual(self.hostname, migrations[0]['source_compute']) self.assertEqual('accepted', migrations[0]['status']) # NOTE(elod.illes): Migration status should be 'error' and not # 'accepted'. Needs to be replaced when bug #1713783 is fixed. # self.assertEqual('error', migrations[0]['status'])

subject: ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-17 12:21:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/525ea3cfac0d91752bdac1bbca4191976d3c592a', 'message': "ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472
(cherry picked from commit ac20fc22adb133d9de5f2ec15faad11b2de1987a)
"}]
commit_message:
ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472
(cherry picked from commit ac20fc22adb133d9de5f2ec15faad11b2de1987a)

commit_message:
Add handlers for consumer_generation

The previous patch added the 'generation' field to the consumers table.
This patch adds the code to increase the generation whenever allocations
are changed for a consumer.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: Ie7b28216a53ceddb643fdaff9d69840d87114cba

commit_message:
Add a microversion for consumer generation

The previous patch added the 'generation' field to the consumer table.
This patch adds microversion 1.22 for handling that in requests as well
as including its values in any returned allocations.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: Ic5fe7d199fa3df39e19d3c93853959e8ebe6e157

commit_message:
Fix docs for IsolatedHostsFilter

The docs were using variable names from the filter code rather
than the actual config options.

Conflicts:
      doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The schedulers configuration doc is not
included in this backport since that doc didn't exist in
nova until Pike via commit da224b3a0.

the volume['volume_image_metadata']['image_id'] into the ImageMeta.id

filtering for volume-backed instances based on a provided image id.

commit_message:
Handle volume-backed instances in IsolatedHostsFilter

The RequestSpec.image object for a volume-backed instance will
not have the 'id' attribute set because the
nova.utils.get_image_metadata_from_volume() method doesn't convert
the volume['volume_image_metadata']['image_id'] into the ImageMeta.id
field. It is unclear if there are intentional reasons for omitting
this information, but the IsolatedHostsFilter has just never supported
filtering for volume-backed instances based on a provided image id.

The logic within the filter depends on the
restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images config option, which
defaults to True. When True, a volume-backed instance will not be
put on an isolated host. When False, a volume-backed instance can
go on any host, isolated or not.

Again, it's unclear if we should actually be filtering volume-backed
servers using the image_id from the volume_image_metadata or not,
but it's not what we've historically done so this change simply
fixes the regression bug.

Change-Id: Ieb8abb1a3f04ce008f9617e051e4d720dbe6917a
Closes-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 0a7427dc58eeb271646a962604106e0e84b870b6)
(cherry picked from commit 4c6443c0b5579853f4b87eb8302d24aca99dddab)
(cherry picked from commit fb723851707d6a764cb8154343087affc19e5db0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/543635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check to see if the image id is set since volume-backed instances # can be created without an imageRef in the server create request. image_ref = spec_obj.image.id \ if spec_obj.image and 'id' in spec_obj.image else None
deleted_lines: image_ref = spec_obj.image.id if spec_obj.image else None

commit_message:
Add regression test for BFV+IsolatedHostsFilter failure

Creating a volume-backed server while using the IsolatedHostsFilter
results in a NoValidHost failure because the filter tries to load
the RequestSpec.image.id but when you create a server from a volume,
an image is not required directly in the server create request.

NOTE(mriedem): The CinderFixture had to be used since the
CinderFixtureNewAttachFlow fixture didn't exist until Queens.

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test needed to change slightly to
disable the DiskFilter since we're using the PlacementFixture which
takes care of DISK_GB filtering.

Change-Id: Id21e0afa5cec401555bee679193c256e55be863b
Related-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 4f9667b7a92ffef4329380e39c64cf314203b06e)
(cherry picked from commit ed959b94ee8a211a270d9d89a6021e76a16bf31f)
(cherry picked from commit 3ff30f407c36264641ea8a1bfe8849d9e7a75f0e)

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from nova import config from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers from nova.tests.unit.image import fake as image_fakes from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture from nova import utils from nova.virt import fake CONF = config.CONF class TestBootFromVolumeIsolatedHostsFilter( test.TestCase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin): """Regression test for bug #1746483 The IsolatedHostsFilter checks for images restricted to certain hosts via config options. When creating a server from a root volume, the image is in the volume (and it's related metadata from Cinder). When creating a volume-backed server, the imageRef is not required. The regression is that the RequestSpec.image.id field is not set and the IsolatedHostsFilter blows up trying to load the image id. """ def setUp(self): super(TestBootFromVolumeIsolatedHostsFilter, self).setUp() self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.CinderFixture(self)) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.PlacementFixture()) api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) self.api = api_fixture.admin_api image_fakes.stub_out_image_service(self) self.addCleanup(image_fakes.FakeImageService_reset) self.start_service('conductor') # Add the IsolatedHostsFilter to the list of enabled filters since it # is not enabled by default. enabled_filters = CONF.filter_scheduler.enabled_filters enabled_filters.append('IsolatedHostsFilter') # Remove the DiskFilter since we're using Placement for filtering on # DISK_GB. if 'DiskFilter' in enabled_filters: enabled_filters.remove('DiskFilter') self.flags( enabled_filters=enabled_filters, isolated_images=[image_fakes.AUTO_DISK_CONFIG_ENABLED_IMAGE_UUID], isolated_hosts=['host1'], restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images=True, group='filter_scheduler') self.start_service('scheduler') # Create two compute nodes/services so we can restrict the image # we'll use to one of the hosts. for host in ('host1', 'host2'): fake.set_nodes([host]) self.addCleanup(fake.restore_nodes) self.start_service('compute', host=host) def test_boot_from_volume_with_isolated_image(self): # Create our server without networking just to keep things simple. image_id = nova_fixtures.CinderFixture.IMAGE_BACKED_VOL server_req_body = { # There is no imageRef because this is boot from volume. 'server': { 'flavorRef': '1', # m1.tiny from DefaultFlavorsFixture, 'name': 'test_boot_from_volume_with_isolated_image', 'networks': 'none', 'block_device_mapping_v2': [{ 'boot_index': 0, 'uuid': image_id, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume' }] } } # Note that we're using v2.1 by default but need v2.37 to use # networks='none'. with utils.temporary_mutation(self.api, microversion='2.37'): server = self.api.post_server(server_req_body) server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ERROR') # Due to bug 1746483 we expect scheduling to fail. self.assertIn("Cannot load 'id' in the base class", server['fault']['message'])

commit_message:
Kuryr-Controller: make handlers pluggable

This patch introduces a new way for configuring which handlers the
Kuryr controller should be using. This will allow people to use
externally provided handlers as long as they are installed as
entrypoints of the right namespace.

Implements: blueprint kuryr-pluggable-handlers

Change-Id: I52ce0ef00771c8587d7f7113cc5eb4839d1309a5
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Add bind mount for logstash and ensure java is installed

This change ensures java is installed where logstash is installed and
changes the logstash data-directory to a bind mount which will ensure
we're not running into space issues inside of our logstash container.

Change-Id: I43f7fb4a8641150c05dcde88a94b65e7c7d2f83a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Return iSCSI Initiator for VIOSes

Adding the get_iscsi_initiators method in iscsi volume adapter
to discover all iSCSI initiators for active VIOSes and return
the first initiator from the sorted collection of initiators.

Change-Id: Ic842bd49e0a3dc6e4f4a3bf14409ca2f70369a26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/00/557800/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _ISCSI_INITIATOR = dict() def get_iscsi_initiator(self): """Gets the iSCSI initiator. for the VIOS. :return: The initiator name. If the VIOS/NovaLink is not capable of supporting iSCSI, None will be returned. #ToDo: To put Locks and check if it can be executed only once. """ global _ISCSI_INITIATOR for vios_id in self.vios_uuids: @lockutils.synchronized('inititator-lookup-' + vios_id) def discover_initiator(vios_id): try: initiator = hdisk.discover_iscsi_initiator( self.adapter, vios_id).strip() return initiator except pvm_exc.ISCSIDiscoveryFailed as e: LOG.error(e) host_name = self._get_vios_host_name(vios_id) if host_name in _ISCSI_INITIATOR: continue else: _ISCSI_INITIATOR[host_name] = discover_initiator(vios_id) LOG.debug("Iscsi Inititator information %s", _ISCSI_INITIATOR) return _ISCSI_INITIATOR

commit_message:
Update old python string format

Currently kubernetes.py debug statement prints utilizes old
string format, thus leading to
TypeError: not all arguments converted during string formatting

Fixed the string format function in debug statements.

Change-Id: I4ef602cf356082ed3d5e8a924336f38a84179430
Task: 14309
Story: 2001857
Signed-off-by: Jui Chandwaskar <jchandwaskar@op5.com>

subject: Run api sample tests against 2.latest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 16:38:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5a951a3e9e7a111a68505fde35e1106e0d9d3edd', 'message': "Run api sample tests against 2.latest

By running api sample tests against a specific microversion we risk
regressions like in this patch's related bug. This patch runs all api
samples tests agaisnt 2.latest, whatever 2.latest happens to be at the
time. While this doesn't cover all microversions, it makes sure that
going forward, all microversions will be test with the full battery of
api sample tests.

To achieve this, a new 2.latest test scenario is added to all api
sample tests. All tests need to pass in the microversion they were
written for, and - assuming that what they're testing hasn't been
deprecated and removed from the API - in the 2.latest microversion.
This means simply passing a version to the template-getting logic
isn't enough, since that would imply a sample for every test for every
new microversion going forward. Instead, a new version_intervals dict
is introduced, which indicates at which points in the API version
timeline requests and responses have changed. Thus, only when there is
a change in the API is a new sample needed. Existing tests and the
template-getting logic are adjusted to use this new dict.

Change-Id: Ide831ac09649a78e0f1971ad4fa99add8d340ec2
Related-bug: 1658571
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 19:02:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3109f06401c5afcee5c479d66098d3fee130dddc', 'message': "Run api sample tests against 2.latest

commit_message:
Run api sample tests against 2.latest

By running api sample tests against a specific microversion we risk
regressions like in this patch's related bug. This patch runs all api
samples tests against 2.latest, whatever 2.latest happens to be at the
time. While this doesn't cover all microversions, it makes sure that
going forward, all new microversions will be tested with the full
battery of api sample tests.

Change-Id: Ide831ac09649a78e0f1971ad4fa99add8d340ec2
Related-bug: 1658571

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I76c2528d825a5f66d34c21a02abf099b8dc547ec
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
remove obsolete tox environments

We no longer need to support 3.4 and 3.5 is covered by the default
debug environment.

Change-Id: I1ca069ea14c619bf64101c1c84bd1b4c3a2d2691
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Clean up W503 and E402 pep8 errors

pycodestyle 2.40 and later enforce these rules that were not previously
enforced. Rather than just skipping them, this cleans up the trivial
instances of these violations.

This does also include some other updates that were not triggering errors
in an attempt to keep some of the style consistent.

Change-Id: Id7c0a6b8f1f835e69d844b000e3ed751852ada63
Closes-bug: #1762803

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Update the lower bound for PrettyTable so the unit tests pass.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ia146248b505e66adf871d17ae1e4921d7888bb85
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Helm-Toolkit: Kubernetes Entrypoint, simplify image dependencies

This PS simplify the logic for dyanmicly merging the image management
depenencies into pod deps when active.

Change-Id: I0cf6c93173bc5fbce697ac15be8697d3b1326d0a

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Because flake8 now runs under python 3 there is no built-in name
'file'. Instead we can use the same symbols from the io module to
build the spec for mocking out the open() call. The old version of
that code that used to only run under python 3 used a private version
of the io module, so that is also corrected.

Change-Id: I2491e65736d2c79f1134eec6371967c39873891b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/38/561338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add skip_latest_microversion decorator

In preparation for running api sample tests against 2.latest, add a
new skip_latest_microversion decorator. This will be necessary to
skip tests that can't be made to pass with 2.latest, for example
because the API they're testing has been deprecated and removed.

Change-Id: I1ca08516d7ccacfc88b2c0e7048b60d58694615b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/433585/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def skip_latest_microversion(reason): """Some tests need to be skipped with 2.latest, for example because they test part of an API that has been deprecated and removed or because their samples are missing some new fields. This decorator is a handy way of indicating that a test_ method should be skipped with the latest microversion. :param reason: A quick message that explains why the test is being skipped with 2.latest. This is required to discourage use of this decorator as a way to weasel out of testing an API with 2.latest. """ def decorator(func): def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs): if self.microversion == avr.max_api_version().get_string(): raise testtools.TestCase.skipException() func(self, *args, **kwargs) return wrapper return decorator

commit_message:
Transform aggregate.update_metadata notification

The aggregate.update_metadata.start and aggregate.update_metadata.end
notifications has been transformed to the versioned notification framework.

Co-Authored-By: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Iab73b1351a50869620334f692aaefb566ba4ddf8
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-rocky

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Because flake8 runs under python 3, where the type "long" has been
merged into int(), we have to ignore the error from the undefined name
in one of the tests.

Change-Id: I86ae7f83d17724d74bae7102dd1775eceb82599d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
ffwd-upgrade cli - adds ffwd_upgrade_converge_plan task for noops

This adds the ffwd_upgrade_converge_plan task in the package_update
workbook. This is invoked from the related tripleoclient review.
Unlike the converge_upgrade_plan task this doesn't run a heat stack
update. Instead it just runs the plan remove_noop_deploystep
which removes OS::Heat::None from DeploymentSteps. The rest of the
ffwd related heat resources are unset using the upgrade-converge
environment file, in the client side, see related review below.

Related:
  python-tripleoclient Ie7823e121a4fa57feb1c56bd4d58f3183e41b8d7
Change-Id: Ib9647b899fb9d49203c4d35c1abfe9c36e0babbe

commit_message:
Fixed tempestconf directory for newton

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551441/ refactored the whole
  validate-tempest role. It introduced a regression at few places.
  It fixes the path of tempestconf directory to use tempest_dir.

Change-Id: I69deba467157ad2134616aacec4368a5d0f5b92e

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

As part of updating the pep8 job to run python 3 we need to remove the
use of the python 2 builtin unicode(). We can use six.text_type() to
produce the same result until we drop python 2 support.

Change-Id: I43c03aeb73bb8a246115400bcbd9a0a68708abd9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Do not log passwords

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

(cherry picked from commit 8641a0240ce1bc5b558c8c0263721b045df8be52)

commit_message:
Add missing RBAC config for Prometheus

Currently the prometheus service is broken because the RBAC config is
missing. The patch just adds it to make it work again.

And the namespace of prometheus and grafana are also changed in this
patch to get a better isolation.

Closes-Bug: #1755772

Change-Id: I05affd9091ad13d70cc074b45d204162f2f4b21e
(cherry picked from commit d07fb7f3cc0c16ad597e930c37b042c26ac78049)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/06/561906/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add KMIP key manager

Adds the KMIP key manager to Castellan and also injects the default
values for the key manager into the conf file. A following patch
will include unit tests and documentation.

Change-Id: I7862e4e16e23ec2dd29ab734737c6890248b358c
Partially-Implements: blueprint kmip-key-manager

commit_message:
Adjust 'overcloud upgrade prepare' call for P->Q upgrade.

During P->Q upgrade we need to pass 'roles-file' to the upgrade
 prepare command.
To address issue described in RHBZ#1541024 we'll pass all the
 environment files, used during initial overcloud deploy.

Change-Id: I1a655cf52630c5eec0387cbea4c480d8072a13f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/22/559722/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: get env files used during deploy shell: | awk '/-e\s|--environment-file\s/ {gsub(/^[ \t]/, "", $2); print $2}' {{ overcloud_deploy_script }} register: initial_env_file - name: assert roles-data file referenced in initial deploy script shell: | awk '/-r\s|--roles-file\s/ {gsub(/^[ \t]/, "", $2); print $2}' {{ overcloud_deploy_script }} register: roles_data_file - name: set roles-data fact vars: default_roles_data: "{{ tht_directory }}/roles_data.yaml" roles_data: "{{ roles_data_file.stdout }}" set_fact: roles_data: "{{ (roles_data_file.stdout|length > 0) | ternary(roles_data, default_roles_data)}}" - name: find EndpointMap in environment files # workaround for https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1541024 shell: | grep -q EndpointMap {{ item }} || echo 'NOT_FOUND' register: endpoint_found with_items: - "{{ initial_env_file.stdout_lines|default([]) }}" - name: add EndpointMap file set_fact: upgrade_prepare_extra_params: "{{ upgrade_prepare_extra_params + [item.item] }}" with_items: - "{{ endpoint_found.results|default([]) }}" when: "{{ item.stdout != 'NOT_FOUND' }}"

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-16 14:33:02.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1764420-flavor-delete-output-7b80f73deee5a869.yaml', 'novaclient/v2/flavors.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/bcc7d8f1138ea22207ac0d31c5be132d6f274b34', 'message': 'Stop printing flavor details on successful flavor-delete

It's weird that the flavor-delete CLI would print out the
details of the flavor the user just deleted, rather than give
some confirmation message, or simply not print anything out
at all, which is arguably more expected behavior when deleting
a resource. This change simply removes the output on successful
deletion which brings "nova flavor-delete" more inline with other
delete CLIs, including "openstack flavor delete" behavior.

While in here, the variable and docstring code is updated to
reflect reality and a release note is added in case anyone was
ever relying on this odd behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1764420
'}]
commit_message:
Stop printing flavor details on successful flavor-delete

It's weird that the flavor-delete CLI would print out the
details of the flavor the user just deleted, rather than give
some confirmation message, or simply not print anything out
at all, which is arguably more expected behavior when deleting
a resource. This change simply removes the output on successful
deletion which brings "nova flavor-delete" more inline with other
delete CLIs, including "openstack flavor delete" behavior.

While in here, the variable and docstring code is updated to
reflect reality and a release note is added in case anyone was
ever relying on this odd behavior.

Change-Id: Ie3e07b45cc70213cde4e6077c604c9f2835c75ad
Closes-Bug: #1764420

commit_message:
Replaced action timeout with action deadline

In some cases (concurrency policy or message redelivered) a
action timeout must be reduced to prevent inconsistent state between
task and actions.

Change-Id: Ic09f2c4fa4293f1d1be5a9f98ff67a7dc23d0bd7
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/18/561118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetime timeout = params.get('timeout', 0) deadline = None if not timeout else (datetime.datetime.now() + datetime.timedelta( seconds=timeout) ).isoformat() if not sync and (save or not is_action_sync): action.schedule(action_input, target, deadline=deadline) deadline=deadline)
deleted_lines: timeout = params.get('timeout') if not sync and (save or not is_action_sync): action.schedule(action_input, target, timeout=timeout) timeout=timeout)

commit_message:
Add support for deploying Kafka

Projects which may use Kafka include Monasca and Oslo
messaging. Initially it will be possible to
deploy a single Kafka cluster which may be shared
among clients. Support for running multiple Kafka
clusters may be added in a future change. This
change also configures logging for Kafka server,
state-change and controller logs.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: Iab8d200c2450238f3c0c708d1f4184490f6e6284

commit_message:
Document how to disable notifications

This adds information to the "notification_format" config
option help and notifications docs on how to disable notifications.

While updating the config option help text, a stale reference
to Pike is removed.

Change-Id: I736025a0a88fc969831558805687b642da8cd365
Closes-Bug: #1761405
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/561684/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Notifications can be completely disabled by setting the following in your nova configuration file: .. code-block:: ini [oslo_messaging_notifications] driver = noop

commit_message:
Pin pycodestyle to <=2.3.1

2.4.0 broke our pep8 tests pretty hard:
http://logs.openstack.org/20/531320/14/check/openstack-tox-pep8/c9d9d10/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-10_15_43_40_014738

Pin pycodestyle until we have time to fix all of those.

Note that this is in the global-requirements blacklist to allow
projects to manage those versions on their own:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/b94a4e8c8fadbdc4c5cac9c4da6755a3c06a7824/blacklist.txt#L13

Conflicts:
    test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I6b0d458c702684779eb21e7022dd0f3193ac72d2
Story: 2001819
(cherry picked from commit fc15be6e329a41ab4cf634c53a54441694c41195)

commit_message:
Pass APIVersionRequest to extensions

Previously, extensions' get_server_create_schema() was passed the
microversion number as a string. This made comparisons such as
version == '2.32' possible, and led to this patch's related bug. This
patch passes an APIVersionRequest object to extensions and removes
APIVersionRequest's __eq__ operator to prevent future code from doing
version equality comparisons, which should never be necessary.

Change-Id: Ic09f4f783307b559c61b1fb522275fd4a0e5f5aa
Related-bug: 1658571
Implements: blueprint fix-tag-attribute-disappearing

commit_message:
Update heat-base hierata to match puppet-heat change

Since Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b, we need www_authenticate_uri
(the patch doesn't seem backward compatible as it ignores auth_uri).
Let's update THT to match this new requirement.

Related-Bug: #1764598
Change-Id: Ib6664ab5e68fbb93ba43e4fdd4b65bee1221c1d6

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I97f940cf3a65ecae202081130b60927ac0cfd467

commit_message:
Application version support

Set the vault app version in juju status using the version
returned from the Vault health data (rather than the installed
snap).

This review also puts in place the atexit handling needed for
general status assessment.

Change-Id: I1f8f0991534f4e130e924ffac733fa13141f0970

commit_message:
Modify default collector as gnocchi in devstack

Ceilometer API is deprecated in Ocata Release[1].
Set collector backend=gnocchi to get metrics from Gnocchi.

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ceilometer/ocata.html#deprecation-notes

Change-Id: Iea7cc16e2f9796f084a08507480d26685c7d200d

commit_message:
Enforce env_variables values to string before run

Converts extra_env_variables values to string because processutils
expect them to be so.

Change-Id: If033001d53f9163ef998fcd162dff1b76fb586d7
Closes-Bug: #1761232

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: EVPN linuxbridge driver, avoid except when bridge is gone

This change removes a stacktrace that appears when a route
is removed and the bridge for the instance has been deleted.

It also ensure that "bridge fdb dump" info is only
retrieved when the log level is DEBUG.

Change-Id: Ie66c7f1132d186495502d8101236a368eb6d4935
Closes-Bug: 1764353
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/32/561832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
only increment disk address unit for scsi devices

We were erroneously incrementing the disk address unit attribute for
non-scsi devices, which resulted in inconsistent disk device naming and
addresses when SCSI devices were used along with non-SCSI devices (like
configdrive devices).

Also, we ensure that we assign unit number 0 for the boot volume of a
boot-from-volume instance.

Change-Id: Ia91e2f9c316e25394a0f41dc341d903dfcff6921
Co-authored-by: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@sileht.net>
Closes-bug: #1729584
Closes-bug: #1753394
(cherry picked from commit 2616b384e642b6eb58eef7da87b6e893f25a949e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/561196/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_guest_config_one_scsi_volume_with_configdrive(self): """Tests that the unit attribute is only incremented for block devices that have a scsi bus. Unit numbering should begin at 0 since we are not booting from volume. """ drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict({ "disk_format": "raw", "properties": {"hw_scsi_model": "virtio-scsi", "hw_disk_bus": "scsi"}}) instance_ref = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) instance_ref.config_drive = 'True' conn_info = {'driver_volume_type': 'fake'} bdms = block_device_obj.block_device_make_list_from_dicts( self.context, [ fake_block_device.FakeDbBlockDeviceDict( {'id': 1, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'device_name': '/dev/sdc', 'disk_bus': 'scsi'}), ] ) bd_info = { 'block_device_mapping': driver_block_device.convert_volumes(bdms)} bd_info['block_device_mapping'][0]['connection_info'] = conn_info disk_info = blockinfo.get_disk_info(CONF.libvirt.virt_type, instance_ref, image_meta, bd_info) with mock.patch.object( driver_block_device.DriverVolumeBlockDevice, 'save'): cfg = drvr._get_guest_config(instance_ref, [], image_meta, disk_info, [], bd_info) # The device order is determined by the order that devices are # appended in _get_guest_storage_config in the driver. # The first device will be the instance's local disk (since we're # not booting from volume). It should begin unit numbering at 0. self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[0], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIn('disk', cfg.devices[0].source_path) self.assertEqual('sda', cfg.devices[0].target_dev) self.assertEqual('scsi', cfg.devices[0].target_bus) self.assertEqual(0, cfg.devices[0].device_addr.unit) # The second device will be the ephemeral disk # (the flavor in self.test_instance has ephemeral_gb > 0). # It should have the next unit number of 1. self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[1], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIn('disk.local', cfg.devices[1].source_path) self.assertEqual('sdb', cfg.devices[1].target_dev) self.assertEqual('scsi', cfg.devices[1].target_bus) self.assertEqual(1, cfg.devices[1].device_addr.unit) # This is the config drive. It should not have unit number set. self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[2], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIn('disk.config', cfg.devices[2].source_path) self.assertEqual('hda', cfg.devices[2].target_dev) self.assertEqual('ide', cfg.devices[2].target_bus) self.assertIsNone(cfg.devices[2].device_addr) # And this is the attached volume. self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[3], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertEqual('sdc', cfg.devices[3].target_dev) self.assertEqual('scsi', cfg.devices[3].target_bus) self.assertEqual(2, cfg.devices[3].device_addr.unit) def test_get_guest_config_boot_from_volume_with_configdrive(self): """Tests that the unit attribute is only incremented for block devices that have a scsi bus and that the bootable volume in a boot-from-volume scenario always has the unit set to 0. """ drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict({ "disk_format": "raw", "properties": {"hw_scsi_model": "virtio-scsi", "hw_disk_bus": "scsi"}}) instance_ref = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) instance_ref.config_drive = 'True' conn_info = {'driver_volume_type': 'fake'} bdms = block_device_obj.block_device_make_list_from_dicts( self.context, [ # This is the boot volume (boot_index = 0). fake_block_device.FakeDbBlockDeviceDict( {'id': 1, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'device_name': '/dev/sda', 'boot_index': 0}), # This is just another attached volume. fake_block_device.FakeDbBlockDeviceDict( {'id': 2, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'device_name': '/dev/sdc', 'disk_bus': 'scsi'}), ] ) bd_info = { 'block_device_mapping': driver_block_device.convert_volumes(bdms)} bd_info['block_device_mapping'][0]['connection_info'] = conn_info bd_info['block_device_mapping'][1]['connection_info'] = conn_info disk_info = blockinfo.get_disk_info(CONF.libvirt.virt_type, instance_ref, image_meta, bd_info) with mock.patch.object( driver_block_device.DriverVolumeBlockDevice, 'save'): cfg = drvr._get_guest_config(instance_ref, [], image_meta, disk_info, [], bd_info) # The device order is determined by the order that devices are # appended in _get_guest_storage_config in the driver. # The first device will be the ephemeral disk # (the flavor in self.test_instance has ephemeral_gb > 0). # It should begin unit numbering at 1 because 0 is reserved for the # boot volume for boot-from-volume. self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[0], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIn('disk.local', cfg.devices[0].source_path) self.assertEqual('sdb', cfg.devices[0].target_dev) self.assertEqual('scsi', cfg.devices[0].target_bus) self.assertEqual(1, cfg.devices[0].device_addr.unit) # The second device will be the config drive. It should not have a # unit number set. self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[1], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIn('disk.config', cfg.devices[1].source_path) self.assertEqual('hda', cfg.devices[1].target_dev) self.assertEqual('ide', cfg.devices[1].target_bus) self.assertIsNone(cfg.devices[1].device_addr) # The third device will be the boot volume. It should have a # unit number of 0. self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[2], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertEqual('sda', cfg.devices[2].target_dev) self.assertEqual('scsi', cfg.devices[2].target_bus) self.assertEqual(0, cfg.devices[2].device_addr.unit) # The fourth device will be the other attached volume. self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[3], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertEqual('sdc', cfg.devices[3].target_dev) self.assertEqual('scsi', cfg.devices[3].target_bus) self.assertEqual(2, cfg.devices[3].device_addr.unit)

commit_message:
pci: update PciDevice object field 'address' to accept NULL

A physical PCI device which provides virtual functions can expose them
using SRIOV framework which creates virtual PCI devices or MDEV
framework which creates virtual devices available thought sysfs.

In order to handle MDEV virtual functions, the PciDevice object should
accept receive NULL value for address field.

Change-Id: I6f39be4c99bc9f2de9ad079844496f8ab608b341
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pci: add support for mdev device type

Provide support for mdev device. While for PCI related devices we
match by vendor, product, address. For MDEV related devices we match
by vendor and/or mdev_type.  In this commit we make the resource pool
stats able to also handle MDEV based devices and manager to accept
handling such device

Change-Id: I2607f37a43c5983f062dfcd34265f31d3915b750
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pci: add for PciDevice object new field mdev

The MDEV devices are identified using an UUID so this commit introduce
a new field mdev to the PciDevice.

Other caracteristics are used to identify a kind of MDEV devices like
the type or the name. They will have to be added as a new key in
extra_info.

Change-Id: Ia8706ad18f395a3d6003f0654df1a9fa498deb77
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pci: generalize object unit-tests for different framework

The current object unit-tests are using SRIOV devices. In this commit
we generalize the unit-tests so that in future there are executed for
MDEV devices.

Change-Id: If98c7787db8a0070dd559287c015eb37552c2497
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pci: generalize stats unit-tests for different framework

The current unit-tests executedfor pci/stats are using SRIOV
devices. In this commit we generalize the unit-tests so that in future
there are executed executed for MDEV devices.

Change-Id: Ia8fd09478ea87edc3899fd1fc39e40fc35ea78a5
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I318f896d21d48eba2d9ccd634042e889038ea5da
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/508835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def format_dom(self): dev = super(LibvirtConfigNodeDevice, self).format_dom() name = etree.Element("name") name.text = self.name dev.append(name) if self.parent: parent = etree.Element("parent") parent.text = self.parent dev.append(parent) if self.driver: driver = etree.Element("driver") name = etree.Element("name") name.text = self.driver driver.append(name) dev.append(driver) if self.path: path = etree.Element("path") path.text = self.path dev.append(path) if self.type: etype = etree.Element("type") etype.text = self.etype dev.append(etype) if self.pci_capability: dev.append(self.pci_capability.format_dom()) return dev def format_dom(self): dev = super(LibvirtConfigNodeDevicePciCap, self).format_dom() for elname in ('domain', 'bus', 'slot', 'function'): value = getattr(self, elname) if value is not None: el = etree.Element(elname) el.text = str(value) dev.append(el) for elname in ('vendor', 'product'): value = getattr(self, elname) if value is not None: el = etree.Element(elname) el.text = str(value) el.set('id', getattr(self, elname + "_id")) dev.append(el) if self.numa_node is not None: numa = etree.Element("numa") numa.set('node', str(self.numa_node)) dev.append(numa) if self.fun_capability: dev.append(self.fun_capability.format_dom()) return dev def format_dom(self): dev = super(LibvirtConfigNodeDevicePciSubFunctionCap, self).format_dom() dev.set('type', self.type) if self.type in ('virt_functions', 'phys_function'): # SRIOV for d in self.device_addrs: addr = etree.Element("address") for i, elname in enumerate(('domain', 'bus', 'slot', 'function')): addr.set(elname, str(d[i])) dev.append(addr) else: # MDEV for d in self.device_addrs: ttype = etree.Element("type") ttype.set('type', d[0]) for i, elname in enumerate(('name', 'deviceAPI', 'availableInstances')): ttype.set(elname, str(d[i+1])) dev.append(ttype) return dev

commit_message:
functional: rework fakelibvirt host pci devices

In this commit we rework the class HostPciDevices to make it able
providing more than SRIOV capabilities

Change-Id: Idfc48e348575e0673889525d4c9fd919fbaa35a2
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/86/508186/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class HostPciDevicesInfo(object): """Base to represent pool of devices with functions""" """Create a new HostPciDevicesInfo object. self.pf_product_id = pf_product_id self.vf_product_id = vf_product_id self.num_pfs = num_pfs self.num_vfs = num_vfs self.numa_node = numa_node self.total_numa_nodes = total_numa_nodes self.group = group if self.num_vfs and not self.num_pfs: self.vf_ratio = self.num_vfs // self.num_pfs if self.num_pfs else 0 self._generate_devices() self._generate_functions() def _calc_numa_node(self, dev): return (dev % self.total_numa_nodes if self.numa_node is None else self.numa_node) def generate_devices(self): pass def _generate_functions(self): pass class HostPciSRIOVDevicesInfo(HostPciDevicesInfo): """Represent a pool of host SR-IOV devices.""" def _generate_devices(self): for dev in range(self.num_pfs): dev_group = self.group + dev + 1 pci_dev_name = 'pci_0000_81_%(slot)s_%(dev)d' % {'slot': PF_SLOT, 'dev': dev} self.devices[pci_dev_name] = FakePciDevice( 'PF', self.vf_ratio, dev_group, dev, self.pf_product_id, self._calc_numa_node(dev)) def _generate_functions(self): for dev in range(self.num_vfs): dev_group = self.group + dev + 1 pci_dev_name = 'pci_0000_81_%(slot)s_%(dev)d' % {'slot': VF_SLOT, 'dev': dev} self.devices[pci_dev_name] = FakePciDevice( 'VF', self.vf_ratio, dev_group, dev, self.vf_product_id, self._calc_numa_node(dev))
deleted_lines: class HostPciSRIOVDevicesInfo(object): """Represent a pool of host SR-IOV devices.""" """Create a new HostPciSRIOVDevicesInfo object. def _calc_numa_node(dev): return dev % total_numa_nodes if numa_node is None else numa_node if num_vfs and not num_pfs: vf_ratio = num_vfs // num_pfs if num_pfs else 0 for dev in range(num_pfs): dev_group = group + dev + 1 pci_dev_name = 'pci_0000_81_%(slot)s_%(dev)d' % {'slot': PF_SLOT, 'dev': dev} self.devices[pci_dev_name] = FakePciDevice('PF', vf_ratio, dev_group, dev, pf_product_id, _calc_numa_node(dev)) for dev in range(num_vfs): dev_group = group + dev + 1 pci_dev_name = 'pci_0000_81_%(slot)s_%(dev)d' % {'slot': VF_SLOT, 'dev': dev} self.devices[pci_dev_name] = FakePciDevice('VF', vf_ratio, dev_group, dev, vf_product_id, _calc_numa_node(dev))

commit_message:
libvirt: add support to start vm with using mdev (vGPU)

The pci manager is now returning a virtual devices using mdev. This
commit is to make the driver to expose it to the guest.

Change-Id: I5edaf50271f139455ab7ad83ca3d7a7b2ae48314

added_lines: def test_config_mdev_device(self): xmlin = """ <device> <name>mdev_4b20d080_1b54_4048_85b3_a6a62d165c01</name> <path>/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:02.0/4b20d080-1b54-4048-85b3-a6a62d165c01</path> <parent>pci_0000_06_00_0</parent> <driver> <name>vfio_mdev</name> </driver> <capability type='mdev'> <type id='nvidia-11'/> <iommuGroup number='12'/> </capability> </device>""" obj = config.LibvirtConfigNodeDevice() obj.parse_str(xmlin) self.assertIsInstance(obj.pci_capability, config.LibvirtConfigNodeDevicePciCap) self.assertEqual(obj.pci_capability.type, "nvidia-11") self.assertEqual(obj.pci_capability.iommuGroup, 12) def test_config_device_pci_cap3(self): xmlin = """ <capability type="pci"> <domain>0</domain> <bus>10</bus> <slot>1</slot> <function>5</function> <product id="0x0FFE">GRID M60-0B</product> <vendor id="0x10DE">Nvidia</vendor> <capability type='mdev_types'> <type id='nvidia-11'> <name>GRID M60-0B</name> <deviceAPI>vfio-pci</deviceAPI> <availableInstances>16</availableInstances> </type> </capability> </capability>""" obj = config.LibvirtConfigNodeDevicePciCap() obj.parse_str(xmlin) self.assertEqual(obj.domain, 0) self.assertEqual(obj.bus, 10) self.assertEqual(obj.slot, 1) self.assertEqual(obj.function, 5) self.assertEqual(obj.product, "GRID M60-0B") self.assertEqual(obj.product_id, 0x0FFE) self.assertEqual(obj.vendor, "Nvidia") self.assertEqual(obj.vendor_id, 0x10DE) self.assertIsNone(obj.numa_node) self.assertIsInstance(obj.fun_capability[0], config.LibvirtConfigNodeDevicePciSubFunctionCap) self.assertEqual(obj.fun_capability[0].type, 'mdev_types') self.assertEqual(obj.fun_capability[0].device_mdev, [{ 'availableInstances': 16, 'deviceAPI': 'vfio-pci', 'name': 'GRID M60-0B', 'type': 'nvidia-11'}])

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-14 15:25:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/ca9990109d99740fe99083118d0058da9fd4c1d4', 'message': "Properly get pip version

version string so we always got the first character of the version

commit_message:
Properly get pip version

The old code was strip()ing the version string instead of split()ing the
version string so we always got the first character of the version
string. This worked fine as long as the pip version was single digit but
as soon as it rolls over to '10.stuff' we will compare:

  pip version 1 (instead of 10) > 6

Which fails bceause 1 is less than six. Instaed we really do want to
compare 10 > 6 so use split on '.' instead.

Closes-Bug: #1764046
Change-Id: Ic7d0c04d7fa77774ab2d70fb9d11f182becec553
(cherry picked from commit 065779517f9c99a80fbc39d51784c614e4ee341c)

commit_message:
Fix wrapping of neutron forbidden error

In neutronv2 api, the neutron forbidden error is not wrapped
correctly. The exception class expects the first parameter as
the error message but an exception object is passed.

Closes-Bug: #1720726
Change-Id: I6e88333427ec2befe2122274b02775f013404e30
(cherry picked from commit f1a0557da4fbd7baa9196cb5c0ccdd7ebb16ecdf)

added_lines: from monitoring.alarms import tables def test_metric_conversion_single(self): res = tables.show_metric_names({"metrics": [{"name": "mem.used_bytes"}]}) self.assertEqual(res, "mem.used_bytes") def test_metric_conversion_multiple(self): res = tables.show_metric_names({"metrics": [{"name": "mem.used_bytes"}, {"name": "mem.total_bytes"}]}) table_res = res.split(', ') self.assertEqual(len(table_res), 2) self.assertTrue("mem.used_bytes" in table_res) self.assertTrue("mem.total_bytes" in table_res) def test_metric_conversion_unique(self): res = tables.show_metric_names({"metrics": [{"name": "mem.used_bytes"}, {"name": "mem.used_bytes"}]}) self.assertEqual(res, "mem.used_bytes")

commit_message:
copy image id to image metadata from volume

According to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204947/ image id is
considered to be
useless and ignored to put to image metadata, but actually, it is used for
IsolatedHostsFilter: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1584747
we should add it back.

Change-Id: Ic0e79cc19a5750373db34b6afa776ff5fcdd0b32
closes-bug: #1584752
closes-bug: #1584747

subject: ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-15 11:58:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ac20fc22adb133d9de5f2ec15faad11b2de1987a', 'message': "ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Closes-Bug: 1751472
"}]
commit_message:
ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/553367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-15 19:38:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3e239ed6531b159c30d924be64fec7d91c6ef5a0', 'message': 'Consume RoleData config from config download files

However, we were already downloading and saving the RoleData to separate

various RoleData driven config files to deploy-steps-tasks.yaml, and to

the inventory (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528354/).

Since the tasks will fail trying to read from the files when not using
config-download, conditional local_action tasks that use the stat module
first verify the existence of the files before attempting to read their

commit_message:
Consume RoleData config from config download files

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525260/, we moved the creation of
various RoleData driven config files to deploy-steps-tasks.yaml, and to
consume the values from various role_data_* variables that were written in
the inventory (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528354/).

However, we were already downloading and saving the RoleData to separate
files via config download. We should consume from those files instead of
the inventory. That has the advantage that one can quickly modify and
iterate on the local files, and have those changes applied. That is
harder to do when these values are in the inventory, and not possible to
do when using dynamic inventory.

Since the tasks will fail trying to read from the files when not using
config-download, conditional local_action tasks that use the stat module
first verify the existence of the files before attempting to read their
contents. If they don't exist, the values fall back to whatever has been
defined by the ansible variable.

Change-Id: Idfdce6f0a778b0a7f2fed17ff56d1a3e451868ab
Closes-Bug: #1749784

commit_message:
Add Gong Yongsheng candidacy for TC

Change-Id: I6c2a5571c2f77e294cd659f78f3e63f0695183eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/21/561821/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi, I am announcing my candidacy for a member of the Technical Committee. Now I am CTO of 99cloud Inc., China. After discussing with my Team (My CEO, COO and R&D department), I made up my mind. This means my company will continue devoting itself into the OpenStack community, help the OpenStack to meet customer’s needs and promote OpenStack to a new high. I was previously a Neutron Core member and am the PTL of Tacker project. Besides this, I am also making contribution to OpenCord project, which is the edge platform for telecom central office. OpenCord project is using OpenStack as the platform to instantiate the VNFs. One more open project I am leading my company R&D to is akraino edge stack, a Linux Foundation project in formation, which will create an open source software stack to improve the state of edge cloud infrastructure for carrier, provider, and IoT networks. I think OpenStack can play a good role in OpenCord and akraino as the infrastructure manager. I agree to Thierry Carrez with the concept of “Constellations” (representation of groups of OpenStack components that answer a specific use case). For example, in the case of MANO system, we need to improve Tacker with OpenStack as NFVI. For DEVOPS, the ZUUL and the whole OpenStack’s CI infrastructure is great, we can also introduce kubernetes into this constellation so that we can meet the DEVOPS needs of container-based or VM-based applications. I am new to TC governance and have the passion to join TC. I am a technical guy and hope I can help to glue the OpenStack projects and keep my eye on their development. As a member of management team, I like to make others succeed and then enjoy their success. So, I will support OpenStack project teams to make OpenStack great again. Thank you for your consideration. Best Regards, Gong Yongsheng (gongysh) [1] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&company=99cloud&user_id=gongysh&release=all [2] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&company=99cloud&release=all [3] https://www.akraino.org/

commit_message:
Fix Alarm Details section in Alarm History view

The change adds dimension key/value pairs to the list of associated
metrics in Alarm Details section of Alarm History view. Without this
list the output is incomplete and confusing.

Story: 2001804
Task: 12529

Change-Id: Ifeaa713a9921d95c1f4ed0b25f28fe9fc7fdd3fe
(cherry picked from commit 841805bffcc9f99c8d2b079f58d9dfb46397a878)

added_lines: from monitoring.alarms import tables def test_metric_conversion_single(self): res = tables.show_metric_names({"metrics": [{"name": "mem.used_bytes"}]}) self.assertEqual(res, "mem.used_bytes") def test_metric_conversion_multiple(self): res = tables.show_metric_names({"metrics": [{"name": "mem.used_bytes"}, {"name": "mem.total_bytes"}]}) table_res = res.split(', ') self.assertEqual(len(table_res), 2) self.assertTrue("mem.used_bytes" in table_res) self.assertTrue("mem.total_bytes" in table_res) def test_metric_conversion_unique(self): res = tables.show_metric_names({"metrics": [{"name": "mem.used_bytes"}, {"name": "mem.used_bytes"}]}) self.assertEqual(res, "mem.used_bytes")

commit_message:
Update prepare using an environment file

We'll be using t-h-t environment files to insert and remove no-ops in
the plan/stack. This should help make the update/upgrade Mistral
workflows more release-agnostic and thus reduce the risk of bugs in
mixed-release UC/OC enviornments.

Depends-On: I486ad0d44f105a6fa9fd24dcf7ac28d40ceecc27
Change-Id: If173d5f6e0be71f467bd062627e9f17e8b684b99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/60/559760/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add the upgrade-prepare.yaml environment to set noops etc templates_dir = (parsed_args.templates or constants.TRIPLEO_HEAT_TEMPLATES) oooutils.prepend_environment( parsed_args.environment_files, templates_dir, constants.UPDATE_PREPARE_ENV)

commit_message:
Add upgrade-[prepare|converge].yaml into upgrade cli

This explicitly adds the upgrade-prepare.yaml environment file
or the upgrade-converge.yaml environment file, into the stored
swift plan, before continuing with the previous workflow (here
heat stack update in both cases). See dependency below in tht
and this tie-in is the biggest downside I can see.

The idea is to stop doing it in the tripleo-common like [1][2]
and move all the upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade cli to use the
same and include the expected environment file.

Co-Authored-By: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/6090d32b516f92837fc8b01b7a55dc97ed3e8a77/tripleo_common/actions/package_update.py#L62-L76
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/6090d32b516f92837fc8b01b7a55dc97ed3e8a77/tripleo_common/actions/plan.py#L492-L502
Depends-On: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c
Change-Id: I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2

commit_message:
Add always tag where it's needed

When running the nova role with the "nova-config" tag the role will
result in failure due to registered variables not being available. This
change simply adds the always tag where it's needed so that the various
tags in the os_nova role can work together or independently.

Change-Id: Id5e8dd2df3c0cbf7cc2e0cf20b5731928dd6a18d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3cb998becd0666d0d449a961aa784fea458486d3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/43/559043/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
networking-bgpvpn: remove networking-odl from required-projects

networking-bgpvpn does not need to draw networking-odl from
git anymore, and the current master of networking-odl causes
a failure to install (see details in bug 1764371).

Change-Id: Ia2154742e9a5a214ff2a59f3035bba3ed790f5f9
Partial-Bug: 1764371

subject: Stop using -python35-jobs-horizon for trove-dashboard
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-17 09:20:08.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/fce02c49cfee97086ff979ee381cf0a06ef1262e', 'message': "Stop using -python35-jobs-horizon for trove-dashboard

We trie to make the py35 jobs temporarily disabled for stable branches
of trove-dashboard in I3421c945534dc249c42cef9977398ce6c376436e,
however it was not working as expected. Recently I found monasca-ui did
a similar change and worked, the difference is that monasca-ui is not
using the openstack-python35-jobs-horizon template, so the problem
should be the 'branches' attribute defined in projects.yaml cannot be
applied the jobs inheritted from project templates.

Change-Id: I34984c0c1942686d751e59adf37b920b66bd15cd
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using -python35-jobs-horizon for trove-dashboard

We trie to make the py35 jobs temporarily disabled for stable branches
of trove-dashboard in I3421c945534dc249c42cef9977398ce6c376436e,
however it was not working as expected. Recently I found monasca-ui did
a similar change and worked, the difference is that monasca-ui is not
using the openstack-python35-jobs-horizon template, so the problem
should be the 'branches' attribute defined in projects.yaml cannot be
applied the jobs inheritted from project templates.

Change-Id: I34984c0c1942686d751e59adf37b920b66bd15cd
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/44/561844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ia254c2a0d12c236d595337aa1f7a9ded7d4ba158
(cherry picked from commit fa1884191903944b88e676434aaa1c984b2c2f27)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-heat refs/changes/27/561527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix kernel post-installation script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 12:59:08.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/drivers/kvm/nova_kernel_permissions.yml', 'files/nova_kernel_permissions'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/9459a2c2b86f5861430b003dd0c9e20edd9cf0e7', 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)

commit_message:
Add missing RBAC config for Prometheus

Currently the prometheus service is broken because the RBAC config is
missing. The patch just adds it to make it work again.

And the namespace of prometheus and grafana are also changed in this
patch to get a better isolation.

Closes-Bug: #1755772

Change-Id: I05affd9091ad13d70cc074b45d204162f2f4b21e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/54/553654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Ief2fecbc266adcc816336b601253d3e90c39c32b
Closes-Bug: #1763300
(cherry picked from commit f451c1a3e2dff69edaf3a72fc215ffa46104a295)

subject: Allow Cloudkitty to collect non-OpenStack metrics
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-26 14:46:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty/commit/69414668892d67bdf87a0610366bbdf2397163a2', 'message': 'Allow Cloudkitty to be used without Openstack:

    * Add a SourceFetcher, which allows to retrieve new type of data sources.
      It allows new collectors to be added.
      (examples: Prometheus, Influxdb, Kubernetes...)

    * Base Cloudkitty on metrics instead of services and resources
      for collecting metrics. This new architecture allows Cloudkitty
      to be more agnostic and so to rate containers metrics as the same way
      as virtual machines metrics.

    * Centralize metrology information in metrics.yml under metrics names.

Task: 6291
Story: 2001501

Change-Id: I00ca080cf05dfc03a3363720f85b79e003eda9be
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-26 15:35:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty/commit/489e0c620abec69272d9ae2f6e2b61b979063a82', 'message': 'Allow Cloudkitty to be used without Openstack:

    * Add a SourceFetcher, which allows to retrieve new type of data sources.
      It allows new collectors to be added.
      (examples: Prometheus, Influxdb, Kubernetes...)

    * Base Cloudkitty on metrics instead of services and resources
      for collecting metrics. This new architecture allows Cloudkitty

commit_message:
Allow Cloudkitty to collect non-OpenStack metrics

* Add a SourceFetcher, which allows to retrieve new type of data sources.
  It allows new collectors to be added.
  (examples: Prometheus, Influxdb, Kubernetes...)

* Base Cloudkitty on metrics instead of services and resources
  for collecting metrics. This new architecture allows Cloudkitty
  to be more agnostic and so to rate containers metrics as the same way
  as virtual machines metrics.

* Centralize metrology information in metrics.yml under metrics names.

Task: 6291
Story: 2001501

Change-Id: I00ca080cf05dfc03a3363720f85b79e003eda9be

commit_message:
Fixes k8s FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning

This commit fixes FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning under kubectl
node events which is not supposed to appear under default settings
pointed out in Kubernetes docs:

    https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/reserve-compute-resources/#enabling-qos-and-pod-level-cgroups.

This is addressed by passing cgroups-per-qos and
enforce-node-allocatable arguments to KUBELET_ARGS when kube worker
nodes are being configured.

Closes-Bug: #1763405

Change-Id: I452840eebb955be9fd178b582be74242e949b662
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/52/560952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # specified cgroup-per-qos and enforce-node-allocatable without which we get FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning under `kubectl describe nodes` KUBELET_ARGS="${KUBELET_ARGS} --cgroups-per-qos=true --enforce-node-allocatable=pods"

commit_message:
Update converge workflow to remove no-ops

The no-opped DeploymentSteps need to be re-added after we're done with
minor update.

Related:
  python-tripleoclient I9656d8c6137fb656aecda7d13768ca4ab3c10b1f

Change-Id: I6abe8cba12806730bb3686d4f2695070c85e468a
Partial-Bug: #1760898

commit_message:
Add test for conditional delegation

This pattern is used in several openstack-ansible roles to control
if tasks are run on the deploy or target hosts, as chosen by the
deployer

Change-Id: I598353c8915762906459146daf4f5a2bbe74fba3

added_lines: # Test for conditional delegation which should be omitted - name: Test delegation which is omitted hosts: container1 gather_facts: no user: root become: True vars: delegate_control: "target-host" tasks: - name: Test container delegation which is omitted command: cat /etc/hostname register: delegated failed_when: delegated.stdout != 'container1' changed_when: false delegate_to: "{{ (delegate_control == 'deployment-host') | ternary('localhost', omit) }}"

commit_message:
Make specifying the nic optional

If a nic is not specified when setting up a vip resource then
corosync should just do the right thing. This change makes the nic
field optional as there is little benefit in using it.

Change-Id: I022a43df0a50a21df3c5f021dcd563da4d20db53

commit_message:
Add libre2 for project-config linting

tox.ini pulls in zuul, but we don't actually install the zuul bindeps.
Zuul has added a requirement on fb-re2 with
Id1b9d7334db78d0f13db33d47a80ffdb65f921df which requires these
libraries.

Change-Id: Ifafdb33752a3bafb5946810878654b0c20d0577c

commit_message:
Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966
Change-Id: I8bf80efc04883cd754c19bea0303064080112c6e
(cherry picked from commit f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c)

commit_message:
Revert config-download mappings in upgrade converge step

We need to restore the default mappings for the resources remapped
by config-download during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I6fe16ad01a299a6e1c13138cee3702827708b19f
Depends-On: I6bd4107e8e1a6a9abc38d2dca7a91a6823f8b6c2
Closes-Bug: #1758065

commit_message:
[API] Test set network as not shared where used via RBAC rule

This patch adds test which checks if network can be set as
not shared in case if it is used by some other than owner
project via specified RBAC rule.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561589
Change-Id: Ie483fa1abbe403f28ec56d86e986984902810b05
Related-bug: #1764330
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/28/561628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('a0478226-0f59-4f5a-92b9-33100c1a306d') @utils.requires_ext(extension="rbac-policies", service="network") def test_update_network_set_not_shared_other_tenant_access_via_rbac(self): shared_network = self.create_shared_network() port = self.client.create_port( network_id=shared_network['id'])['port'] self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_port, port['id']) self.admin_client.create_rbac_policy( object_type='network', object_id=shared_network['id'], action='access_as_shared', target_tenant=self.client.tenant_id ) updated_network = self.admin_client.update_network( shared_network['id'], shared=False)['network'] self.assertFalse(updated_network['shared'])

Add a rule to prevent passwords to be logged

Lint rule to make sure no module argument looking like "password"
will get logged.

subject: bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-17 09:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bagpipe/agent/bagpipe_ml2/agent_extension.py', 'networking_bagpipe/tests/unit/agent/bagpipe_ml2/test_agent_extension.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/commit/1ac1a2f6e145040ce88d5cb656314771eac99431', 'message': 'bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port

The agent extension for bagpipe ML2 was calling do_port_plug_refresh
before having removed the port from internal datastructure, hence
causing the detach_port to be followed by a bogus attach_port.

This change fixes the code and the unit test.

commit_message:
bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port

The agent extension for bagpipe ML2 was calling do_port_plug_refresh
before having removed the port from internal datastructure, hence
causing the detach_port to be followed by a bogus attach_port.

This change fixes the code and the unit test.

Change-Id: Ie0786855a1e67c163c9710c10e5539aceb56ab08
Closes-Bug: 1764702

commit_message:
Vagrant: Document the increased Octavia reqs

The default vagrant values are insufficient for running Octavia
amphorae. This patch addresses it in documentation.

Change-Id: If0147adb39793b4601f7b00bec34aa9d593ecbc4
Closes-Bug: 1708173
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
tests: don't configure plugin for tests that don't need it

Except test_subnet, there are no more object tests that would require
the plugin configured, so let's not go through the hassle of setting it
up. (For the record, this setup was not needed since
If1252c42c49cd59dba7ec7c02c9b887fdc169f51).

Change-Id: Iafb886c17dbf9a91a3514b0caa1bcd14093a796c

commit_message:
Fix the kuryr group missing for inventory file

Now, the kuryr is missing in inventory file, it will result in the
kuryr role just can run in compute group[0], the ps to fix it.
